bf0c3981fa27a391.title: Quant Platform Research Engineer
bf0c3981fa27a391.description:
G-Research is Europe’s leading quantitative finance research firm. We hire the brightest minds in the world to tackle some of the biggest questions in finance. We pair this expertise with machine learning, big data, and some of the most advanced technology available to predict movements in financial markets.
The role
We are seeking a first-class developer to join our Quant Platform Engineering (QPE) group. QPE has been at the core of G-Research’s profitability for over 15 years.
Our mission is to provide engineering and technical expertise to enable the business to capitalise on new opportunities and research ideas rapidly. The role is technically challenging and requires an ability to adapt to new technologies at pace, such that the firm’s existing advantage is maintained.
There are several Quant Platform Research Engineering teams working directly within the Research function in order to help them develop their research and deliver it through to production.
Areas of focus for these teams include:
Research Pairing – Working alongside researchers to help them build new features into our cutting edge prediction capabilities
Framework Engineering – Using our core expertise and experience to help researchers build well-engineered frameworks for the longer-term
Productionisation – Integrating new strategies produced by our researchers into a live system, and monitoring their performance and reliability
Research tooling – Workflow and efficiency improvements for our quant researchers
Strategy – Engaging other areas of G-Research to influence the firm’s collective direction to fit with the future direction of quant research
Back testing – Adding new features into our simulation pipeline when required
The core tech stack is C# and python, productionised in our own datacentres. We use the latest compiler/toolchain available – .NET Core and Python 3, deploying to Kubernetes.
Who are we looking for?
The ideal candidate will have the following qualities, skills, and experience:
Collaborative working attitude with both customers and peers
Strong drive to deploy your improvements to a live environment
Intelligent, capable and hands-on engineer with a genuine interest in technology
Proven ability to engineer high-quality software
Appreciation of good architecture and engineering best practices
Confidence to experiment with new ideas and technologies
Financial or statistical background would be advantageous, though all backgrounds are welcome
Why should you apply?
Highly competitive compensation plus annual discretionary bonus
Lunch provided (via Just Eat for Business ) and dedicated barista bar
30 days’ annual leave
9% contributory pension scheme
Informal dress code and excellent work/life balance
Comprehensive healthcare and life assurance
Cycle-to-work scheme
Monthly company events
G-Research is committed to cultivating and preserving an inclusive work environment. We are an ideas-driven business and we place great value on diversity of experience and opinions.
We want to ensure that applicants receive a recruitment experience that enables them to perform at their best. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation please let us know in the relevant section

93857e3fa618447b.title: BI Engineer
93857e3fa618447b.description:
Do you want to be part of a Sunday Times Top 100 Best Company to work for in the UK? Well, look no further! In 2021, we've been accredited as one of London's Top 50 best mid-sized companies and recognised for our outstanding commitment to workplace engagement, and have our eyes on the prize for 2022 as well!
ABOUT RATED PEOPLE
Rated People is a dynamic marketplace tech company connecting c.1 million homeowners each year with our network of >50k trades businesses to get important jobs done across the whole of the UK. Our product is disrupting a £50 billion a year home improvements sector and helping trades services companies, which provide 1 in 12 jobs in the UK, grow their businesses. Our goal is to make home improvements stress free and enjoyable for both homeowners and tradespeople, to drive trust and make the process as smooth as possible.
We were recently named a Times 100 top place to work and are a VC-backed scale-up with a spacious HQ in Shoreditch and headcount of ca. 100 passionate, innovative employees. We delivered our first profitable year in 2020 (despite the pandemic!) and have ambitious growth goals with a people-first approach, as we genuinely believe that empowered, happy and motivated employees deliver better commercial results.
OUR VALUES
At Rated People, we live and breathe our 4 E values (empathise, enable, empower and experiment) and are looking for amazing culture contributors who share our core values and care about our culture just as much as we do! For us, culture is not something that happens from the top down – everybody is a culture driver and has the autonomy to shape our working environment to make Rated People a psychologically safe, fun and inclusive space for everyone.
THE ROLE
Data is the nucleus of Rated People’s operation and is the key to the fundamental business decisions we make daily. To drive the company forward, we’re looking for a talented data engineer to join our expanding revenue operations team. You’ll be working with data and driving insight across the entire organisation, from the ongoing growth of our data lake to the integrations with our external dashboarding and CRM platforms. You will be responsible for taking care of our data estate, continually identifying how we can improve our data services and driving best practice. If you have a passion for complex systems and problem-solving complex data engineering challenges from start to finish, then this is the right position for you.
Revenue Operations is a centralised, cross functional team that regularly collaborates with all areas of the business, including sales, customer operations, finance, marketing and our executive team to drive decision-making and enablement at Rated People. The team provides real time data dashboard support, leads ambitious data science projects, manages the sales and operational infrastructure and develops key strategic frameworks to help us provide our customers with the best experience from Rated People.
ABOUT YOU
You are an inquisitive, innovative and data driven self-starter who has a hunger to learn and improve your skillset in the ever-evolving field of data exploration. We are looking for someone who will push for best practice and continuous improvement at all times. You will be eager to keep up with new technologies and continually update your technical knowledge and skills.


Responsibilities include:

The continual improvement and maintenance of our data estate
Interfacing with developers, analysts, and business stake holders to gather data related requirements, plan effective solutions and then develop the optimal solution
Maintaining and taking on the continued development of our Talend based ETL
Develop our long term ETL strategy as we look to new solutions
Supporting integrations and data flows both in and out of the data estate for 3rd party integrations
Ensuring our data is stored in the most performant way, for ease of use and best practice


Required skills and experience:

You have 3+ years of commercial experience delivering complex solutions in a data engineering role where you have worked with engineers, analysts and key stakeholders to develop and maintain data solutions
Proven track record of delivering modern BI, ETL and Data Warehousing solutions (Talend/SSIS/AWS Glue etc)
Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight or similar tools
Solid understanding of data warehousing principles and data structures
Expert level T-SQL skills including SQL query performance optimisation
Ability to on-board yourself to new technologies with ease
Familiarity with traditional relational databases and NoSQL
Comfortable with popular programming languages to at least an intermediate level (JAVA/Python)


It would be great if you have prior knowledge of:


 Agile methodologies
 AWS infrastructure
 Docker


Don’t be put off if you do not meet 100% of the skills and experience - far more important to us is an inquisitive mindset, willingness to learn and a can-do attitude.
WHAT WE OFFER
We’re proud to offer an environment perfect for creativity, fun and sharing ideas. We offer a competitive salary and a generous range of benefits:

25 days holiday (plus one day for every year of service, max 30 days)
Strong and inclusive company culture we all shape and take ownership and pride in, including companywide events, surprise and delights, roundtables and culture clubs
Market-leading private medical insurance on ‘medical history disregarded’ terms, access to the virtual GP service (Babylon) and mental health cover
Perx - Member Benefit Platform
Cycle to work scheme
Life assurance
Travel loans
Fresh fruit, coffee and tea and food cupboard
Enhanced parental leave policy

8a99ba71f77b2cf0.title: Lead BI Engineer
8a99ba71f77b2cf0.description:
If you’re passionate about Business Intelligence and are seeking a new challenge where you can motivate and develop a team of like-minded individuals in a fun, fast paced and ever-changing environment, then this role could be just what you’re looking for!
A bit of background…
We have undergone a transformation in recent years, taking over the Tech industry in the north of the UK with a significant investment into IT to align with our vision of being a digital business. We’re also the UK's leading consumer delivery specialist, and that’s because we’re obsessed about providing our customers with the ultimate delivery experience.
As a result of this, we’re currently looking for a Lead BI Engineer to join our Assurance and Engineering team on this exciting journey.
The team are focused on continually improving the end-user experience, working with key stakeholders and using their knowledge and expertise to ensure ongoing data integrity.
If successful, you will be responsible for managing the BI Engineering team within the Enterprise Data Services area, setting standards for technology best practice and working with key stakeholders to facilitate the efficient delivery of a modern BI platform.
Some of the perks of working with us…
You'll join the team at our vibrant, state of the art Tech Hub at the top of a prestigious office building at the core of the grade A West End office area of Leeds overlooking the city skyline and riverside. Who wouldn’t want to go to work with this view every day?
With its own innovation lab, the Tech hub showcases bespoke content on a rotating screen as well as displaying the latest prototypes such as a drone, a VR headset and a smart lock. Another perk of the job includes use of our large ultra-wide monitors to deliver the very best ultra-creative environment for developers.
Our culture…
We want you to feel as comfortable at work as you are in your own living room which is why we encourage a casual approach to office attire.
We also offer flexible working (flexible start, finish and lunch times) plus the option to work from home, along with the opportunity to drive your own professional development, including training courses.
What we’re looking for…
Your day to day life will include carrying out the following activities:
Coordinating multi-disciplined teams (including managers and senior managers) company-wide to ensure technical activities and artefacts are suitable for releasing data products into production
Working with the architecture team (e.g. the data architects) to ensure BI solutions are designed according to best practice for the SAP platform
Defining and maintaining best practices to ensure ongoing data integrity
Working with the Principal of Data Engineering to ensure that the team is delivering in-line with the overall data strategy
Managing, motivating, developing and engaging the SAP BI Engineering team
Supporting the team’s focus on delivering against business priorities
Attending and contributing to data design authority workshops to ensure that any data deliverables align with the enterprise data model
Knowledge & Experience:
Essential:
Experience leading enterprise level BI projects in SAP technology
End to End BI delivery experience
Understanding and experience of delivery using agile principles
Desirable:
Experience with Financial Planning components
Experience of managing a diverse team in a growing organisation
Technical & People Skills:
Essential:
Ability to coach people to improve their technical skills experience
SME in the SAP BI stack (including Hana)
Desirable:
Experience of encouraging cross functional development practices
Qualifications:
Essential:
Excellent Maths, English and Computing Skills
Desirable:
Accredited agile qualification

This role will focus on the development of enhanced reporting and will work heavily on Tableau powered by Snowflake so will suit someone who can push the system to its limit and upskill other team members.
A successful candidate will:

To contribute during sprint planning meetings, daily stand-ups and retrospectives, demonstrate software delivered to stakeholders during sprint retrospectives
To contribute user stories

Advanced Tableau development skills with significant experience working with Tableau, developing complex interactive reports & dashboards

What will you get for this role?

Up to 40% discount for some Aviva products through “My Aviva Extras” plus discounts for Friends and Family (some exclusions apply)
Excellent range of flexible benefits to include a matching share save scheme
Working at Aviva
At Aviva, we’re people with a purpose. To be with you today, for a better tomorrow.
We bring this to life by ensuring managing risk is at the heart of the way we all work. We love people who do the right thing for our customers, and our colleagues. We want people who speak up, who take responsibility, and who make good decisions.
The way we do this is important too. We’re all about our people – that’s you – so we can be pretty flexible. If you want to work from home some of the time or change your hours so you can pick up your kids or care for someone in your family, we’re very open to that. In fact, we don’t advertise roles as either part or full time, because we know each person has different needs, just as each business area has different needs. We care deeply about being inclusive and that means we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We want our employees to bring their whole self to work and that starts with you.

We’d love it if you could submit your application online . If you require an alternative method of applying, please give Daniela Krol a call on 0121 234 7660 or send an email to daniela.krol@aviva.com
*As defined in The Equality Act 2010 *. By ‘ minimum criteria’ we mean you should provide us with evidence which demonstrates that you generally meet the level of competence required and have the qualifications, skills or experience defined as essential to perform the role.

1bd05e6d98150e66.title: Financial Engineer/ Quantitative Analyst, Financial Risk Analytics
1bd05e6d98150e66.description:
About Us
IHS Markit's Financial Risk Analytics (FRA) continues to innovate and deliver best in class risk analytics to its clients. Our solution suite is comprised of Traded Market Risk (including the Fundamental Review of the Trading Book), Buy Side Risk, Counterparty Credit Risk, Stress Testing, and derivative valuations adjustments (xVA) solutions. The solutions cover a broad range of asset classes including Equities, FX, Rates, Inflation, Fixed Income, Commodities, Credit and Structured Products. The suite of products and solutions enable our clients to effectively calculate, manage and hedge risks on their derivative portfolios. FRA sits within Financial Services division of IHS Markit.
We are looking for a Financial Engineer/Quantitative Analyst to join our Financial Engineering team. The team is responsible for building and supporting our financial risk analytics library for all client use cases.
Your Role
You will be part of the Financial Engineering team in London. Working alongside other Financial Engineers, software developers and product experts you will be responsible for adding risk analytic capabilities to our solution suite. Specifically, you will work on the enhancing the Buy Risk solution in terms of product coverage, risk measures and any specific buy side regulatory requirements. Additionally, the team is responsible in supporting existing clients and showcasing modelling capabilities in our products to new prospects.
Key responsibilities include:
Develop, test, validate and maintain analytics library with respect to: Structured products pricing models viz. MBS, ABS etc., Derivative and Fixed Income pricing models, and Market Risk Models viz. MC and Historical VaR, Expected shortfall
Integrate and work on external pricing libraries like Intex and AD&Co
Work with senior stakeholders to crystallise product ideas into production code.
Quickly iterate over ideas for internal and external proof of concepts.
Interact with clients to explain the analytics library and modelling decisions.
Work with Product Management and Engineering teams to handle workflows of Buy side risk solution viz (Pricing and sensitivities, Stress testing, Back testing, PLA, Regulatory reports)
Analyse current industry practices and regulatory updates and its impact on client use cases.
Document pricing and risk models for internal and external audience.
Support professional services with specific client queries.

About You
You are a highly motived individual who loves working on analytical problems. You have experience with working on structured products pricing like RMBS, MBS, ABS etc. You will be well versed in financial derivatives and Fixed Income products. You have worked on third party libraries like Intex and AD&Co. You should be good with a programming language eg. Python and are willing work in other languages which are used in the solution stack. You will be interacting with other teams and with clients as well, hence good written and oral communication is essential for this role. You should be able to articulate complex ideas effectively to internal and external audience.
Key Qualifications and Skills:
Numerate degree in a quantitative field.
Minimum 5-6 years’ experience as a FE / Quant Analyst at buy side firm, Investment Bank or other risk analytics company
Proficient programming skills in at least one language.
Experience with third party libraries like Index and AD&Co
Experience in financial derivatives, financial risk management
Knowledge of development processes and version control system e.g. Git.
Effective written and oral communication skills with the ability to interact with multiple teams internally
Good to have:
Familiarity of Scala, Spark
Familiarity with XVA, Counterparty credit risk modelling.
-

4677aa15578b9a22.title: Business Intelligence Engineer, Supply Chain
4677aa15578b9a22.description:
Master degree in a scientific subject / mechanical engineering / supply chain management
2+ years of experience in a highly analytical environment
Strong SQL skills
Strong data analysis skills, ability to produce, interpret and draw conclusions from data
Experience with operations/supply chain
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel is a must have
Ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment.
Organized, self-starter and a quick learner.
Must be an independent problem solver that can make high quality judgments and decisions quickly with excellent organization skills.
Must be detail-oriented with a demonstrated ability to self-motivate and follow-through on projects.
Excellent communicating skills coupled with ability to comfortably and confidently present to all levels within the company is required
Experience of dealing with results, metrics and data management and desire to create and build new processes

The EU Supply Chain team is looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer, as part of the Supply Chain analytics team. You will contribute to defining, building, and automating data pipeline and infrastructure to optimize our transfer and fulfilment systems. You will chase defects in our systems, leaving no stone un-turned to delight our customers with wider selection. This role will give you a unique view on Amazon systems, process and operations, interacting with planning teams, fulfillment centers and technical teams. If you are someone who has shown success in analyzing, diving deep in complex data, streamlining and identifying process improvement opportunities and pioneering new ways to do things, we’d like to talk to you. This position is preferably based out of our EU Headquarters in Luxembourg but can also be in other cities in Europe.

Responsibilities

You will lead some critical performance management initiatives to improve our transfer and fulfilment systems in Europe leveraging complex data management and visualization:

Guide buying, placement and other relevant stakeholders with regards to further optimize current system’s decision making to improve long term cash flow for the business.
Establish the right framework to optimize manual transfer process; design and own a set of metrics to measure transfer success against different scenarios
Pioneer new ideas to improve and automate the POD transfer algorithm to better support FC launches in an ever-growing network complexity
Pilot and implement your recommendation in production through smart configurations in Amazon systems
Develop the analytics required to visualize opportunities and measure progresses
Data science background is a plus
Knowledge of R / Python / any tool allowing visualization and automation will help you go further in your job
Knowledge of OR / Modelling is a plus

800575155339fabc.title: Senior Analytics Engineering Consultant
800575155339fabc.description:
Salary: £75,000 to £85,000 + profit share*
Location: Brighton or Remote (UK only)
About Us
Rittman Analytics is an analytics consultancy based out of Brighton. We help fast-growing and data-rich businesses to build an analytics capability that scales.
Using systems like Fivetran, dbt, Snowflake, Google BigQuery and Looker we work with our clients to design, build and support innovative analytics solutions that empower end users to answer their own questions - we are experts in the modern data stack.
The Role
We are looking for someone who has experience as an Analytics Engineer with great SQL skills and experience working with modern data stack tools such as dbt and Looker.
You would be coming in to lead our client projects to build high quality, well organised and performant data models. Some of the things you could be doing include:
Data Stack implementation/deployment
Configuring data warehouses
Modelling data into insightful schemas
Cleaning and transforming raw data into consumable information and business logic
Testing data to ensure it is of high quality
Documenting business logic and data definitions
Ensuring data models are running reliably in the production environment
Developing dashboards, explorations and visualising data
Training clients on the infrastructure, maintenance and use of the system
What We're Looking For
Real-world experience with modern data stack tools such as dbt, Looker, Fivetran, Google BigQuery and/or Snowflake
Outstanding analytical, problem-solving and technical skills, a head for numbers and an attention to detail
An excellent grasp of SQL, data modelling, cloud data warehousing and database design
Experience using software development methods (git, CI/CD, code reuse etc) in an analytics context
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to translate key requirements into actionable technical requests
A pragmatic approach to getting things done and good time management skills
A keen commercial awareness in order to understand stakeholders challenges and identify needs beyond the immediate

Profit share is paid quarterly and is 4% of gross profits distributed equally between permanent employees working in the delivery team. Profit share becomes effective following successful completion of a probationary period.

f5881428f07a57ed.title: Business Intelligence/Dashboard Engineer
f5881428f07a57ed.description:
We are Digital Science and we are advancing the research ecosystem. We are a pioneering technology company, and our vision is of a future where a trusted and collaborative research ecosystem drives progress for all.
We believe in better, open, collaborative and inclusive research. In creating the next generation of tools and working in partnership with the community we tackle some of the biggest challenges to research. In order to achieve our vision, we need innovative, inspiring and dynamic people to join our team. Do you want to join us in achieving our vision?
Dimensions, part of the Digital Science family, is the world’s largest linked research information dataset, covering millions of research publications and connected by more than 1.3 billion citations. We are shaping the future of research and are looking for a Business Intelligence Engineer to join the team.
About the role:
As part of the global and technically skilled team, you will play a key role in the delivery of analysis through the design, development, and implementation of interactive dashboards to allow our customers to engage with data and analysis results to support their decision-making processes.
Your role will touch all aspects of data analysis & delivery, from the design of analysis, data collection/wrangling, visualization, and the development & delivery of interactive dashboards. You’ll be working with the latest analytics and visualization technologies in order to leverage the power of the Dimensions data platform.
Working closely with other team members, including customer-facing data scientists, you will deliver great services and solutions through building data sets to convey insights on the research landscape to our customers which include all types of R&D organizations (university, Pharma, publisher).

Responsibilities:
Design new dashboards using visualization tools like Data Studio and Looker, working in close collaboration with end-users and stakeholders to define and prototype the end results
Designing data models and SQL-based reporting solutions, implementing changes to meet the business need, as well as performing maintenance and BAU tasks such as creating technical design documentation and granting users access to our tools
Contribute to defining and maintaining our data visualization platform roadmap and strategy, and policies and procedures
Support the growth of the team, by keeping abreast of market and industry trends and sharing knowledge and experience with them
Requirements:
You will have an interest in the STM field and be experienced in dashboard development (Looker/Qlik/Dash/Data Studio/Tableau)
It would be advantageous if you have experience in Python scripting for data wrangling and dashboard automations
You will have broad experience of working with relational database management system with a proficiency in SQL and BigQuery
You will have experience of developing custom data visualisations (eg, JavaScript)
Experience with cloud-based architectures, AWS and Google Cloud would be advantageous
An excellent problem solver, you excel in navigating complex problems to create manageable tasks
You will thrive in an environment where you can work independently and remotely and can take ownership of project deliverables
You will have previous experience of working globally and across multiple teams
You will be a strong communicator and able to communicate your findings to a varied audience through written and verbal presentation
You will be comfortable working in a fast paced, changing environment and utilise this to empower your career with us
Video interview
Tech test
Video Interview
SQL, BigQuery, Looker, Qlik, DashSQL, BigQuery, Looker, Qlik, Dash, Data Wrangling, Python, JavaScript, AWS, GCP

ea3a8803f006b7a1.title: Senior Solution Engineer - Business Analytics
ea3a8803f006b7a1.description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
We are currently recruiting for our UKI Solutions Engineering Presales team!
Be a product expert on the world’s leading data visualization and analytics platform.
Fluent in the local language of the region(s) you are applying to?
Love the idea of working with prospective and existing customers, and a range of internal business functions?
Excited by the thought of being a Trusted Business Advisor to our customers?
Keen to help customers evaluate Tableau from a technical standpoint?
Thrive on the idea of partnering with our internal sales teams to drive adoption?
And thrilled to present at the top data and analytics conferences and events?
We’d love to hear from you if this sounds like you.
Who we are…..
Tableau is a clear market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for BI & Analytics. We develop software that helps people to see and understand data. We’re now also part of Salesforce, one of the world’s largest cloud-based software groups.
Not only do Tableau have world-class products, Tableau is also one of the most in-demand and fastest growing marketable skill in the world!
At Tableau, who we are is as important as what we do, and Tableau’s Core Values sets the stage for all employees. We’re always on the mission to collaborate and provide world-class products. Through respect, honesty and just keeping it simple, it makes delighting our customers easy!
Why join us?
Come aboard if you are excited by challenges and at ease working across teams. We encourage our employees to bring their authentic selves to work, and you’ll be surrounded by people who speak their minds and measure success not by how many hours are worked but by what gets accomplished.
How do some of your potential team describe the key parts of their role?
· Be a Trusted Business Advisor to our customers:
· o Understand their business challenges and data/analytics strategies;
· o Identify the best solution for them, and;
· o Support them to achieve their business goals.
· Enable customers to be more data driven. Showcasing and exciting them in Tableau’s solution;
· Consult on technical and analytical advisory matters;
· Pre-sales support in partnership with our internal direct sales team(s);
· Build outstanding customer relationships, driving adoption of Tableau within accounts and resulting in customer success;
· Build exceptional relationships and provide knowledge excellence, including presenting at events such as Cinema Tour, Iron Viz, Big Data Summit;
· Troubleshoot technical challenges; develop content for demos and training workshops
· Help steer the future product roadmap.
Who we look for….
We are looking for people who have proven pre-sales expertise gained in the software industry.
Preferably you’ll have a broad technical awareness, together with some expertise in SOME of: Data Visualisation/Analytics, BI, or the data related space, such as data quality, integration, MDM, databases or a related space.
· Experienced. Skillset to establish trust with clients, and ability to influence during the sales cycle.
· Highly Technical. Hands-on technical experience in some of the areas mentioned above.
· Domain. Experience building and delivering Proofs of Concept (PoCs) and responding to functional & technical elements of RFIs/RFPs.
· Passionate. A passion for technology and translating that passion into business impact for customers.
· Communication. Excellent verbal communication, written communication, and presentation skills in front of all audiences.
· Flexibility. To travel as needed and to work flexibly as required.
What you’ll achieve in your first year:
· Complete Tableau’s world-class boot-camp program.
· Your Tableau Desktop Certified Associate and Certified Professional qualification.
· Your Tableau Server Certified Associate qualification.
· Support the full sales cycle from discovery, evaluation to close on a set of accounts or territory.
· Ownership of a key initiative area to support development for your whole team.
· Attend and present best practices at one of our world-class marketing events.
· Partner with your account executives on territory, account and opportunity planning.
· Influence product direction by feeding back customer requirements from the field to our product management and engineering teams.
· Be an integral part of our customers’ ongoing success through continual engagement in your accounts
· Be a valued part of our incredible Tableau community through forums, blogs and social media.
· Recruit and mentor the next generation of Tableau talent.
Pre-Sales, Presales, Pre Sales, Solution Consultant, Solutions Consultant, Solution Architect, Solution Engineer Analytics, Business Intelligence, Tableau, Data Visualisation

c9dc8b18d18b50a6.title: Analytics Engineer
c9dc8b18d18b50a6.description:
News UK is a phenomenal company full of talented, dedicated, and creative people. We are an ambitious and ever growing organisation with a real passion for quality content and storytelling. Our newspapers and digital products include some of the most powerful media brands in the world, reaching over 30 million people each month. Our brands include national newspapers - The Sun, The Times, and The Sunday Times - as well as the Wireless Group, comprising of talkSPORT, talkRADIO, and Virgin Radio and several regional radio stations.

Your Team: You’ll be joining the Analytics team within the Data Hub to help maximise our relationship with 500,000+ subscribers on The Times and Sunday Times and 30m+ monthly readers of The Sun, contributing to continued annual growth. We are at the forefront of innovative approaches to both data and customer experience, evidenced by the team recently winning 4 ‘best use of data’ awards, living up to our vision of driving the business through data.

Your Role: You will add value to our titles by partnering with Analytics and Technology teams, working to provide access to and optimise datasets to power reporting and analysis as we strive to increase understanding of customer behaviour, content and product performance. You will work closely with engineers and analysts to understand and overcome data challenges, prototype and productionise datasets, ultimately enabling actionable insights to improve decision making, acquisition, engagement and retention for our brands.

Day to day you will:

Proactively explore ways to enhance our data quality and reliability by analysing and combining raw data from different sources and identifying opportunities for data acquisition before building well tested, up to date and documented datasets.
Work closely with Analytics and Data Technology teams, ensuring we are capturing, ingesting and surfacing the right data to meet business needs and objectives, defining successful outcomes, and designing standardised datasets to drive consistency of results and business value from our data.
Utilise strong communication skills to understand to comprehend the data needs of end users across the business and design and create tables using best practices to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality data optimised for self-serve.
Help to define, improve and champion our internal standards for style, maintainability, and best practices for a high-scale data infrastructure, governance and query writing
Document and publish completed projects, queries and datasets to internal platforms so it is searchable and can enable analysts to easily pick up and utilise what you have delivered.
Be an influential figure within the Analytics team by coaching best practice and upskill the analysts’ ability to write efficient, well-thought out and structured queries.
What we are looking for:
Behavioural Skills:
You’ll drive business value and action from your work, from leading technology meetings and capturing requirements to confidently presenting and communicating your recommendations.
You’ll communicate proactively, clearly and regularly to influence a variety of senior stakeholders, being unafraid to stand up for your work and voice your opinions.
You’re the go-to person for Data Technology teams, maintaining relationships and proactively updating stakeholders on progress.
You are an influential figure in the team who people look up to and are a role model for cross-functional collaboration, mentoring and upskilling the team, ensuring the best work is produced and giving regular feedback to colleagues.
Curiosity to learn more and creatively interrogate data, working with team leads to prioritise and then manage your own team’s time to meet committed deadlines.
You spot opportunities to automate analytics tasks, allowing you to focus on tackling and breaking down the more complex business problems.
Technical Skills:
You love SQL - writing efficient, advanced SQL queries and programming languages.
Strong experience in designing database schemas to simplify the use and analysis of raw data from various systems
You'll have significant knowledge in data modelling and in conducting ETL/ELT with large and complex data sets.
You enjoy working with data from event log systems - e.g. web analytics / clickstream raw logs such as Google Analytics and data from advertising server logs such as DFP
Strong experience in creating and maintaining data quality processes and documentation.
Confident communication and business stakeholder management skills to effectively manage expectations.
A love of data and/or a problem solving mindset involving deep-dive analysis on complex data

Life at News

At News UK some of us work flexibly, in many different ways. We encourage you to talk to us about the flexibility you need. We can’t promise to offer exactly what you want, but we do promise not to judge you for asking.

We champion diversity and inclusion, we strive to maximise and encourage every individual’s potential and ensure everyone feels valued. We support this through our Diversity Board, D&I strategy & training, creating more diverse content and our intern and apprenticeship programmes. We also have 8 employee-led networks; Cultural Diversity, News is Out, GenZ, Sustainability Champions, News for Parents, Women in Tech, News UK Christian Fellowship and we are awaiting the launch of our Women’s Steering Group.

We take pride in looking after our amazing talent at News UK supporting the Health and Wellbeing of our staff. We offer private medical insurance covering pre-existing conditions, discounted gym memberships, ClassPass at Home, weekly virtual HIIT, yoga and run club classes, and a ‘Bikes for Work’ scheme, as well as offering opportunities for physio/massage, counselling and legal support.

In addition we also offer:

A generous pension scheme with employer contributions of up to 5%;
25 days holiday and up to 4 volunteering days per year;
Maternity leave up to 18 weeks full basic salary & paternity leave up to 2 weeks;
Wide range of training available, plus full LinkedIn Learning access.

We want to ensure that everyone we meet has the opportunity to perform to their best when interviewing, so feel free to let us know, at any stage, whether you require any reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, and we will do our best to accommodate.

fbe8e863089db5a4.title: Quantitative Engineer - Corporate Treasury - Corporate Treasury Strats (ALM) - Vice President
fbe8e863089db5a4.description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:

ENGINEERING
What We Do
At Goldman Sachs, our Engineers don’t just make things – we make things possible. Change the world by connecting people and capital with ideas. Solve the most challenging and pressing engineering problems for our clients. Join our engineering teams that build massively scalable software and systems, architect low latency infrastructure solutions, proactively guard against cyber threats, and leverage machine learning alongside financial engineering to continuously turn data into action. Create new businesses, transform finance, and explore a world of opportunity at the speed of markets.
Engineering, which is comprised of our Technology Division and global strategists groups, is at the critical center of our business, and our dynamic environment requires innovative strategic thinking and immediate, real solutions. Want to push the limit of digital possibilities? Start here.
Who We Look For
Goldman Sachs Engineers are innovators and problem-solvers, building solutions in risk management, big data, mobile and more. We look for creative collaborators who evolve, adapt to change and thrive in a fast-paced global environment.
Engineering- Corporate Treasury Strats Analyst/Associate
Corporate Treasury strategist (or strat) is a highly collaborative role requiring close interactions with the Corporate Treasury, Trading, and Market and Credit Risk management functions. A member of our team would be able to use their engineering and/or scientific background to identify and measure risk and to implement quantitative and technical risk management solutions in software. A successful strat would be highly analytical, driven to own commercial outcomes and will be able to communicate with precision and clarity.
Corporate Treasury works closely with the CFO, Treasurer and other members of senior management to manage the firm’s liquidity risk, secured and unsecured funding programs, and the level and composition of consolidated and subsidiary equity capital. The department plays a key role in firmwide strategic and analytical projects, providing a unique insight into the firm’s business activities and performance..

Your Impact:

Corporate Treasury Strats use their engineering and/or scientific background to implement quantitative analytics and management solutions in software. Corporate Treasury Engineering products guide funding sourcing decisions, allocation of financial resources, quantification of funding costs, and strategies to minimize costs and hedge risks. Successful strats are highly analytical, driven to own commercial outcomes, and communicate with precision and clarity.

Corporate Treasury Strats welcomes applicants with a Masters or a PhD in financial engineering/financial math; quantitative sciences, e.g. physics, statistics, applied math or other quantitative discipline; or relevant professional experience. Strong analytical skills, mathematical fluency, and programming abilities are required.
Our primary objectives are to:
Maintain an appropriate level of excess liquidity to protect against market-wide or Goldman Sachs-specific stresses and to meet intraday liquidity requirements
Determine the appropriate funding strategy for assets based upon their liquidation profiles
Raise funding across diverse markets, investors, and products; and,
Hold adequate capital to protect against risk of loss and to meet regulatory requirements
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

Responsibilities include:
Participate in the firm’s liquidity risk analysis, cash & collateral management, and asset liability management
Build liquidity and ALM models in the firm proprietary programming language
Understand and evolve/project the firm’s liquidity needs/risks to model the excess liquidity buffer requirement.
Work with treasury, desk strategists, and technology departments on model creation, testing, signoff, maintenance, and methodology enhancements
Be responsible for modeling methodologies, code base, and infrastructure
Analyze model output and facilitate understanding of model results by non-technical clients
Interact with Regulators on regulatory issues, requests, and capital issues
Qualifications:
Corporate Treasury Strategists (or Strats) welcomes applicants with academic background in a quantitative field such as Engineering, Mathematics or Physics - advanced degrees (PhD or Master’s) or Bachelor’s with relevant technical work experience. A strong analytical, mathematical and programming background is preferred.
Solid background in computer programming, C/C++/Java/MATLAB or equivalent language, preferentially in large scale financial or technical computations
Familiarity with financial markets, financial assets, and asset pricing is a definite plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Self-motivated team player.
ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS:

ABOUT GOLDMAN SACHS
At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.


We believe who you are makes you better at what you do. We're committed to fostering and advancing diversity and inclusion in our own workplace and beyond by ensuring every individual within our firm has a number of opportunities to grow professionally and personally, from our training and development opportunities and firmwide networks to benefits, wellness and personal finance offerings and mindfulness programs. Learn more about our culture, benefits, and people at GS.com/careers.


We’re committed to finding reasonable accommodations for candidates with special needs or disabilities during our recruiting process. Learn more: https://www.goldmansachs.com/careers/footer/disability-statement.html
© The Goldman Sachs Group, Inc., 2021. All rights reserved.
Goldman Sachs is an equal employment/affirmative action employer Female/Minority/Disability/Veteran/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

5c2ce1e78b847b32.title: Analytics Engineer
5c2ce1e78b847b32.description:
Nottingham Trent House (95002), United Kingdom, Nottingham, Nottinghamshire
Analytics Engineer
About this role
The Analytics Engineering Team at Capital One is continually innovating the way data tools and products are developed, helping to transform how analysts work. We do this by applying our analytics, engineering and business skills to the development of internal data tools, harnessing data and technology to make it easier for our users to extract relevant insights and drive value.
So, if you have experience building data-focussed software products, a commitment to shipping iterative solutions that deliver business value, and a thirst for the innovative and creative, we think you’ll feel right at home as one of our Analytics Engineers.
What you’ll do
Design, develop and maintain high quality, business focussed software packages and data solutions, helping our users to work more efficiently with large datasets
Partner with internal customers to understand their requirements and provide recommendations, ensuring there is a balance between timelines, high quality delivery, technical cost and risk
Flex your interpersonal and design skills to translate the complexity of the work into key business results
Drive thinking across the team, focussing on the engineering approaches and technologies used to drive effective solution design and best practice
You will have the amazing opportunity to learn;
A modern approach to developing production quality packages in Python
A robust approach to version control, testing and automated CICD pipelines using tools such as GitHub, pytest and Jenkins
Agile software development methods working as part of a team
Solving real world problems with customers from across the UK business
What we’re looking for
Experience of writing efficient Python to process and analyse large datasets. Ideally you’ll have used data focused libraries such as pandas and numpy
Experience processing or analysing datasets, interacting with databases, data warehouses or data lakes
A passion for making development as efficient and reliable as possible - for example, you may have experience with git, unit testing frameworks, CICD pipelines or some data-focused cloud storage services (e.g. AWS S3)
You love the process of developing software products, but also share our passion for understanding the business. You know at the end of the day it’s about reaching the right outcome for our customers
You love innovation and evaluating emerging technologies. You stay current on published state-of-the-art methods, technologies and applications and seek out opportunities to apply them
We are committed to creating a level playing field and seek to create teams that are representative of our customers and the communities we serve. We’d love to hear from you if you identify with a typically under-represented group in our industry and are particularly keen to hear from women, the LGBTQ+ community and ethnic minority candidates.
Where and how you'll work
 This is a permanent position and can be based in either our Nottingham or London offices. We’ve adopted a flexible hybrid working model - one that creates the opportunity to work in your own way, but also provides great spaces for in-person collaboration.
Our core in-the-office days are Tuesday to Thursday, but they aren't mandatory - you’ll be led by your team, the type of work you do and of course your preferences. Many of our team have flexible working patterns so we’re open to discuss flexible working arrangements with you.
You can read more about the full announcement from our Founder and CEO Rich Fairbank here : Update on CapitalOne.com
What’s in it for you
Bring us all this - and you’ll be handsomely rewarded with a role contributing to the roadmap of an organisation committed to transformation
We offer high performers strong and diverse career progression, investing heavily in developing great people through our Capital One University training programmes (and appropriate external providers)
Immediate access to our core benefits including pension scheme, bonus, generous holiday entitlement and private medical insurance – with flexible benefits available including season-ticket loans, cycle to work scheme and enhanced parental leave
Open-plan workspaces and accessible facilities designed to inspire and support you. Our Nottingham head-office has a fully-serviced gym, subsidised restaurant, mindfulness and music rooms. In London, you can heighten your mood with a run on our rooftop running track or an espresso at the Workshop Coffee café
What you should know about how we recruit
We pride ourselves on hiring the best people, not the same people. Building diverse and inclusive teams is the right thing to do and the smart thing to do. We want to work with top talent: whoever you are, whatever you look like, wherever you come from. We know it’s about what you do, not just what you say. That’s why we make our recruitment process fair and accessible. And we offer benefits that attract people at all ages and stages.
We also partner with organisations including the Women in Finance and Race At Work Charters, Stonewall and upReach to find people from every walk of life and help them thrive with us. We have a whole host of internal networks and support groups you could be involved in, to name a few:

17df250acfb7d222.title: Senior Analytics Engineer
17df250acfb7d222.description:
At Freetrade, we believe investing should be accessible to everyone. It's one of the best ways to grow your savings but, for many, it seems complicated, expensive, and out of reach.

We're here to change that.

We're a technology company that brings simple investing to everyone. We've built a beautiful app to buy and sell shares and ETFs in a fluid, mobile-first experience.

Our goal is to help our customers achieve better, long-term financial outcomes, chipping away at one of the biggest issues of our generation: wealth inequality.

In 2022, we're rolling out our app across the EU, transforming our product with new features and functionalities, and introducing new products. In the UK, we now have over 1.2m registered users, a team of over 300, offering a range of products like the Freetrade Pension, a stocks and shares ISA, and our premium account, Freetrade Plus. Our media brand, Freetrade Honey, offers daily insights alongside deep dives into the companies and trends that the new generation of investors care about most.

This has all been possible because of the backing of a passionate group of over 10,000 crowdfunding investors. As we've scaled, we've also raised money from world-class growth investors including Left Lane Capital, Molten Ventures, and L Catterton to supercharge our growth.
We're looking for a Senior Analytics Engineer who possesses a passion for solving complex business problems through data.

You will

Champion self-service data analytics - partnering with business teams and power users to improve our data literacy and understanding the art of the possible
Own the governance of our Looker, Data Studio platforms, ensuring that our data models are consistent with our information architecture
Deliver training, support and best practice to data producers and consumers improving platform usage and trust in our data
Work closely with business functions to understand our data taxonomy, including building data dictionaries
Perform code reviews and work with analysts and engineers to ensure data has appropriate tests to monitor data quality and integrity
Support change management, ensuring our data reflects current and historical business rules

About you

You're a BI tool expert (ideally with Looker and Data Studio)
You're familiar with LookML or a similar data modelling language
You're a confident communicator capable of owning projects end to end with strong acumen for business analysis and user engagement
You're an advanced SQL user and familiar with complex skills
You're well versed with modern data architecture including experience with cloud data warehouse technologies and confident working with large datasets (e.g. BigQuery, Snowflake)
You possess an excellent understanding of data integrity and data quality
You have proven experience with star and snowflake schema modelling

Logistics:

The application process consists of; an initial phone interview with one of our internal Talent Specialists; a short technical screen; a cultural & values interview; a second real-world technical interview and a final chat with our Head of Data.

We offer a competitive salary plus stock options and lots of other benefits.

You'll have a stake in the company you're building, with stock options benchmarked to US companies.

We are an Equal Opportunity employer committed to a diverse and representative team. Whatever your race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or disability - we want to hear from you. We're very open about what we're working on, and the best places to learn more are our buzzing community forum and our blog.

Please note we are not accepting agency CVs.

061fc03c4547e817.title: Simulation & Analytics Engineers (all levels) – Life Science Team
061fc03c4547e817.description:
Computational Simulation & Analytics
We’re on the lookout for exceptionally talented individuals with a relevant engineering degree (mechanical, aerospace, materials) or similar (applied physics, data science, maths etc.).
Check out what our Life Sciences team is all about: https://vimeo.com/659671042/0d97d66f30
This role is a unique opportunity to help change the face of engineering within the medical devices & pharmaceutical industry. Crux are world-leaders in simulating both medical devices and the human bodies they interact with. We use a mix of physics-based models and machine learning techniques to design and improve novel technologies. The role also involves test rig design and lab experiments for those who like a mix of computer-based modelling and hands-on experimentation.
Skills we’re looking for...
1st or 2:1 degree in a relevant subject
Strong understanding of engineering & design (including maths and physics)
Experience in computational modelling such as FEA or CFD
Coding (particularly Python and Matlab)
Proficient in CAD
Knowledge of engineering materials
Experimental and/or prototyping skills
Appetite for solving difficult and unusual problems
Ability to work within multiple cross-disciplinary teams and be client facing

About Crux...
Crux is an innovative and dynamic engineering and product development consultancy, taking pride in its outstanding work and a warm and supportive workplace environment. Our projects are truly world-reaching, working as trusted partners to pharmaceutical companies and household brand names to deliver products to global markets. Collaboration between people in all areas of our business is key to our success, so open and friendly multi-way communication is encouraged at all levels.
Why you’ll love working here:
You’ll be working with a family of high performing expert engineers. Our strong community is built upon effective communication and happy employees, collaboration in project work and regular social events are the norm.
If you’re interested in working on multidisciplinary design projects, tackling some of the toughest briefs in the medical and consumer goods sectors then we want to hear from you.
Interested? Email your CV and covering letter to careers@cruxproductdesign.com and add ‘Simulation & Analytics Engineers’ as the email subject.

d45cd6f2d956ea98.title: SQL Engineer
d45cd6f2d956ea98.description:
SQL Engineer
An established organisation based near Warrington are currently looking for a SQL Engineer to join the team and further aid in the firms ambition of developing data as an asset.

The business are currently in the process of migrating over to Dynamics365 and Azure, and so are looking for skilled individuals who are keen to further their knowledge of Microsoft technologies and upskill in the Azure stack.

The SQL Engineer will be responsible for the design and development of SQL integration projects, through source data, structuring data for best use and presentation. They will assist with changing SQL routines and structures using the MS toolset whilst also supporting in definition of business requirements and preparation of testing scripts / user acceptance documents.

The successful SQL Engineer will have the following experience:

Knowledge of data acquisition, data modelling and office integration solutions provided by Microsoft
Detailed understanding of Data concepts
Understanding of project methodologies and business process
SQL Server solution knowledge with ability to contribute to delivering end-to-end solutions to meet complex business requirements
Experience with SQL, Query builds, data analysis and table/meta design

There are multiple roles available, and so the business are happy to speak to people from junior backgrounds as well as senior.

The salary on offer ranges up to £45,000 which comes in addition to a bonus, 26 days holiday, pension and more.

The role can be fully remote, with occasional visits to the office necessary for meetings etc. The business also offer flexible working hours to best suit the employee at the hiring managers discretion.

Interviews will be taking place ASAP – apply today to register your interest.

Please note: Candidates must be based in the UK and of relatively close proximity to Warrington

SQL Engineer

7f1542765df67863.title: Lead Analytics Engineer
7f1542765df67863.description:
Salary up to £60,000
About us
At Codeweavers, we build and maintain an automotive platform which delivers solutions that help facilitate many aspects of the car buying journey. Our platform helps to power sites used by millions of people every day. We work with many sectors of the automotive industry including Retailers, Web Agencies, Car locator sites, Manufacturers and Lenders.
About the role
We’re looking for a passionate and experienced Lead Analytics Engineer to join our Analytics Team. As a growing team, there are countless opportunities for you to make an impact as we continue to make leaps towards being a key player in the automotive industry for data. This vision is supported by the large reach of our products across retailer and OEMs websites across Europe, which allows us to collect and report on market, vehicle, pricing & customer treads.
This is a fantastic opportunity to help challenge the way we shape and use the data across our platform. Working closely with your product delivery team, you will take the lead in shaping our data pipeline and improving our data maturity through investigations and implementation of new tools & technologies.
Within this role you will use your previous experience to drive the use of our tools, and advise on improvements where applicable, ensuring that we are up to date with the latest technologies.
In addition, you will work across multiple teams to help advise and highlight potential improvements to our data pipeline, as well as monitor the success of changes made to our processes.
On a day-to-day basis, you will be responsible for:
Working with the product owner to shape and guide the product roadmap with technical considerations in mind
Maintaining & improving the architecture of our data pipeline
Working within the Analytics Team to support the implementation and delivery of robust data models
Working across teams to help drive solutions and practices forward
Working across teams to ensure best tracking practices are followed
Maintaining & improving complex data models to allow for cost effective and prompt reporting
Our Technologies
Our platform is currently built in C# and makes use of the following technologies and frameworks:
Analytics Platforms (Snowplow Analytics, Google Analytics)
Cloud based data products (Google BigQuery, Google Dataflow)
BI Tools (Looker UI, Looker LookML)
Cloud storage (Amazon S3, Google Cloud Storage)
Snowplow (Data Pipeline Management)
.NET technologies such as .NET framework, .NET Core, ASP.NET, WebAPI, MVC etc.
PostgreSQL, Cassandra and Microsoft SQL Server databases
Frontend Applications (TypeScript and Angular)

Development tools
Looker
BigQuery
Visual Studio + Resharper / JetBrains Rider
One trunk source control via SVN
In-house project management tool
Slack
Requirements
We’re interested in hiring a talented, passionate Lead Analytics Engineer. For all applicants we would expect:
No challenge is too big or small.
You accept feedback gracefully.
You’re confident to engage with your team.
You question decisions and ideas that you do not understand or agree with.
Desire to work in a respectful, transparent and collaborative environment.
Able to commute to our office in Dunston, Staffordshire on occasion as required by your team.
Skills and Experience
You don’t have to be a perfect match for the list below, if you have a majority and enjoy learning and improving please apply:
3-5 years of work experience as a data engineer/lead
Graduated with a 2:1 or First Class in a software, data, mathematics or statistics related degree, or have similar experience
Experience with Python and SQL
Experience with object-orientated programming language
Ability to write efficient and cost effective queries
Desirable skills:
Experience with C#, TypeScript, Angular
Experience writing clean, performant C# code
Knowledge of data science practises
Experience with Kubernetes, Docker and GCP
Benefits
Other reasons to join our team:
Remote working.
23 days holiday plus bank holidays + 1 for each year of service.
A great social scene including an annual sports day and an awesome Christmas party.
Access to a wealth of tools and resources to learn at your own pace:
The Codeweavers library, if there’s something missing let us know.
Digital learning resources (plural sight etc).
Opportunities to attend conferences and workshops.

78dc25208f09a2d1.title: Senior Solution Engineer - Business Analytics, Tableau
78dc25208f09a2d1.description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
We are currently recruiting for our UKI Solutions Engineering Presales team!
Be a product expert on the world’s leading data visualization and analytics platform.
Fluent in the local language of the region(s) you are applying to?
Love the idea of working with prospective and existing customers, and a range of internal business functions?
Excited by the thought of being a Trusted Business Advisor to our customers?
Keen to help customers evaluate Tableau from a technical standpoint?
Thrive on the idea of partnering with our internal sales teams to drive adoption?
And thrilled to present at the top data and analytics conferences and events?
We’d love to hear from you if this sounds like you.
Who we are…..
Tableau is a clear market leader in the Gartner Magic Quadrant for BI & Analytics. We develop software that helps people to see and understand data. We’re now also part of Salesforce, one of the world’s largest cloud-based software groups.
Not only do Tableau have world-class products, Tableau is also one of the most in-demand and fastest growing marketable skill in the world!
At Tableau, who we are is as important as what we do, and Tableau’s Core Values sets the stage for all employees. We’re always on the mission to collaborate and provide world-class products. Through respect, honesty and just keeping it simple, it makes delighting our customers easy!
Why join us?
Come aboard if you are excited by challenges and at ease working across teams. We encourage our employees to bring their authentic selves to work, and you’ll be surrounded by people who speak their minds and measure success not by how many hours are worked but by what gets accomplished.
How do some of your potential team describe the key parts of their role?
· Be a Trusted Business Advisor to our customers:
· o Understand their business challenges and data/analytics strategies;
· o Identify the best solution for them, and;
· o Support them to achieve their business goals.
· Enable customers to be more data driven. Showcasing and exciting them in Tableau’s solution;
· Consult on technical and analytical advisory matters;
· Pre-sales support in partnership with our internal direct sales team(s);
· Build outstanding customer relationships, driving adoption of Tableau within accounts and resulting in customer success;
· Build exceptional relationships and provide knowledge excellence, including presenting at events such as Cinema Tour, Iron Viz, Big Data Summit;
· Troubleshoot technical challenges; develop content for demos and training workshops
· Help steer the future product roadmap.
Who we look for….
We are looking for people who have proven pre-sales expertise gained in the software industry.
Preferably you’ll have a broad technical awareness, together with some expertise in SOME of: Data Visualisation/Analytics, BI, or the data related space, such as data quality, integration, MDM, databases or a related space.
· Experienced. Skillset to establish trust with clients, and ability to influence during the sales cycle.
· Highly Technical. Hands-on technical experience in some of the areas mentioned above.
· Domain. Experience building and delivering Proofs of Concept (PoCs) and responding to functional & technical elements of RFIs/RFPs.
· Passionate. A passion for technology and translating that passion into business impact for customers.
· Communication. Excellent verbal communication, written communication, and presentation skills in front of all audiences.
· Flexibility. To travel as needed and to work flexibly as required.
What you’ll achieve in your first year:
· Complete Tableau’s world-class boot-camp program.
· Your Tableau Desktop Certified Associate and Certified Professional qualification.
· Your Tableau Server Certified Associate qualification.
· Support the full sales cycle from discovery, evaluation to close on a set of accounts or territory.
· Ownership of a key initiative area to support development for your whole team.
· Attend and present best practices at one of our world-class marketing events.
· Partner with your account executives on territory, account and opportunity planning.
· Influence product direction by feeding back customer requirements from the field to our product management and engineering teams.
· Be an integral part of our customers’ ongoing success through continual engagement in your accounts
· Be a valued part of our incredible Tableau community through forums, blogs and social media.
· Recruit and mentor the next generation of Tableau talent.
Pre-Sales, Presales, Pre Sales, Solution Consultant, Solutions Consultant, Solution Architect, Solution Engineer Analytics, Business Intelligence, Tableau, Data Visualisation
Accommodations
If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form .

At Salesforce we believe that the business of business is to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive Equality in our communities and workplaces. We start with an engineering mindset and different thinking, then continuously refine our ideas, unwilling to compromise until we’ve found a better way.

a6af656e737efd8f.title: Business / Customer Intelligence Engineer
a6af656e737efd8f.description:
Marin Software provides a leading cross-channel advertising cloud for performance marketers to measure, manage and optimize more than $6 billion in annualized ad spend across the web and mobile devices. Offering an integrated SAAS platform for search, display and social advertising, Marin helps digital marketers improve financial performance, save time, and make better decisions. Advertisers use Marin to create, target, and convert precise audiences based on recent buying signals from users’ search, social and display interactions. Headquartered in San Francisco, with offices worldwide, Marin's technology powers advertising campaigns in more than 160 countries.

Marin prides itself on its stellar work-life balance and relaxed atmosphere. Sure, we work hard to develop leading online advertising management solutions. We’ve even won awards from major industry organizations and publications. Why get stressed about it? At Marin, you can rest assured that you’re working with the best and brightest – and that you won’t develop migraines in the process. And, with offices in all of the world’s most important tech hubs, we’re surrounded by good food, great views, and all the best the big city has to offer.

About the role:
The ideal candidate is experienced in front-end development and has an interest in broadening their horizons within Business Intelligence or backend development. You will be working within a small team that strives for innovation, automation and continuous improvement across a variety of systems (internal and vendor-based).
The Customer Intelligence team is currently focused on improving the UX and design of our marketing optimization engine, and deploying Looker’s business intelligence platform to democratize data across departments. By joining our team you will have the opportunity to improve our customers' experience and promote a culture of data-driven decision making.

Responsibilities:

Work with the frontend engineering team to deploy enhancements to our Insights feature, a digital marketing optimization engine built on a Typescript/Angular framework
Leverage user interaction data to design enjoyable user workflows
API microservice development
Git code management
Support development of data architecture & accessibility (ETLs, data warehouse, Looker)
Support development of backend software development (Django, Python)
Contribute to data analyses & dashboarding initiatives

What's exciting about this role:
Work with an interesting tech stack - many valuable languages to learn or expand your knowledge of, for example this role will help build your BI experience
Be involved in our move towards DevOps
Work with a Best practise team delivering production ready, enterprise quality code in a Continuous Development environment. You’d work alongside very experienced, global Tech team with colleagues in the Bay Area (San Francisco), Shanghai and Paris
Petabyte scale of Data - build your Data Engineering know how
Autonomy to work in the way you want, but with enough support to ensure you learn and grow
Plenty of opportunities to introduce a change
Interesting and challenging problems to resolve
Freedom to use a mix of tools: build it yourself, use open source or third party tools - whichever is more efficient at a given task.
Variety of work: in one day you might be querying our data warehouse, pulling data across hundreds of data clouds, running ETLs on publisher APIs, developing a microservice, browsing through elastic search logs or launching frontend features available directly to our clients

Requirements:
Previous coding experience in a professional (work) environment. Able to demonstrate and defend previous work
Experience working with frontend stacks such as Angular/Typescript
Familiarity with backend databases and APIs
Interest in new technologies, approaches, and methodologies
Passionate about the impact of your work
Getting things done approach
Self-starter and eager to learn
Experience with python a plus
Experience with Looker or similar BI platform a plus
Good Base salary
Stock
Medical and Dental insurance for you and family as well as other benefits
Remote working available (within the UK)
2 stages - one technical exerciseAngular, TypescriptLooker

c6bf99436dad956e.title: Senior BI Engineer
c6bf99436dad956e.description:
We're all here for a reason.
Dojo exists to empower businesses to thrive in the experience economy. In an increasingly digital world, we harness technology to create tools that turn transactions into meaningful relationships.
Here, we go home each day knowing we've made a difference —our 5-star Trustpilot rating tells us that!   
We lead the way with a product that reaches millions of people daily. No really, that's how many transactions we process a day—and we do it in 1.7 seconds.
We make bold moves to shape an industry where disruption is long overdue —driven by an industry-leading NPS score of 57+.   
We do it for our customers, their customers and each other. And crucially, we do it for ourselves. To solve problems and make tomorrow better than today.
Everyone at Dojo is here for a reason—every single brilliant one of them. Curious, relentless and customer-obsessed, we're united by our shared ambition to help businesses do more. It’s what gets us up in the morning. Well, that, and our in-house baristas.
So, if you’re ready to jump in feet first to an ever-evolving business and embrace the candour it takes to develop, we can’t wait to see what you could achieve here.
The Role
As a rapidly growing technology business, the need for data-driven decision making is critical and this means we’re putting significant investment into our data group. You’ll be a key part of that team, overseeing the rapid rollout of Looker across the organisation on top of Snowflake and dbt.
What you will do…
Migrate users away from ad-hoc manual reporting to reporting process that scale with the company
Depreciate legacy reporting solutions such as PowerBI and Datastudio
Utilise dbt to contribute towards centralised data models to be used for reporting
Comprising of BI and business specialists, you’ll play a leading role in the team, providing engineering guidance and leadership on how problems can be solved efficiently and communicating proactively on progress and best practice
What you will bring…
You have extensive experience in rolling out a modern business intelligence platform at scale. With knowledge in the supportive architecture namely developing ELT pipelines, data warehousing and data modelling.
You are motivated by making a commercial impact through your work. You’re pragmatic and know when to use which technology
You have got demonstrable experience in leading and developing solutions that support analysis and business processes in commercial environments.
You know how to shape requirements, work productively, communicate with your stakeholders and organise resources
You can communicate effectively within a team and with non-technical stakeholders to understand requirements
You have got a keen eye for detail and are renowned for having high standards in your work
Ideally you will also have experience with…
Looker platform administration
MPPs, especially BigQuery and Snowflake
dbt for transformation
Cloud services and infrastructure, especially Google Cloud Platform
You’re comfortable working in an agile environment
Looker LookML Certified but not essential
Benefits:
Growth - satisfy your thirst for knowledge and development with our dedicated L&D team and Culture Amp.
Network - get together with social clubs, annual celebrations, Mobfit cook-a-longs, social slack channels and more.
Mind - keep your head in check with our employee assistance programme, mental health champions and Spill.
Health - look after yourself with Vitality health insurance, free eye tests and a whole host of onsite fitness classes.
Security - have a little peace of mind with life insurance, enhanced maternity & parental leave and a salary sacrifice pension plan.
Pocket - cut your costs with season ticket and parking loans, cycle to work scheme and a whole host of retail discounts.
Diversity & Inclusion
We are an Equal Opportunities employer committed to a diverse and representative team. Different opinions, perspectives and personalities push us forward. We want to hear from people who are passionate about their work and align with our values. Regardless of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, neurodiversity or disability - whoever you are, if you’re curious, relentless and customer-obsessed, we want to hear from you.
For Recruitment Agencies
We do not accept unsolicited CV, biography and/or other candidate material received from any third-party recruitment agency or organisation under any circumstances without the prior written approval of a member of our Talent Acquisition team.
Please do not contact us with unsolicited submissions as they will not be recognised by us for the purposes of 'ownership' of any candidate.

£400-500 PER DAY, 3 MONTHS
