48c57b5af40ee006.title: Risk Quantitative Engineering - Associate/VP, London
48c57b5af40ee006.description:
MORE ABOUT THIS JOB:

RISK
The Risk division is responsible for credit, market and operational risk, model risk, independent liquidity risk, and insurance throughout the firm.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS:

RISK ENGINEERING
Risk Engineering ("RE"), which is part of the Risk Division, is a central part of the Goldman Sachs risk management framework, with primary responsibility to provide robust metrics, data-driven insights, and effective technologies for risk management. RE is staffed globally with offices including Dallas, New Jersey, New York, Salt Lake City, London, Warsaw, Bengaluru, Singapore, and Tokyo.
In Risk Strats, we are a team of quantitative experts charged with managing the firm's capital, stress testing and risk management, and providing the overall financial control and reporting functions. The team is also responsible for designing, implementing and maintaining quantitative measures of risk such as Value at Risk, Exposure Modelling and also developing Stress Testing framework used to determine the firm's capital requirements. The division is ideal for collaborative individuals who have strong ethics and attention to detail.
RESPONSIBILITIES AND QUALIFICATIONS
The responsibilities of the strategist include:
Develop, implement, and maintaining quantitative measures of risk ("Risk Models") such as Value at Risk, Exposure Modelling and stress testing and capital models in order to assess the risk of the Firm's businesses.
Implement models in production using sophisticated software, such as object-oriented computer languages and design tests to ensure the accuracy of implementation.
Coordinate across multiple groups, including strategists, technology and controllers to implement the new capital regulations.
Communicate clearly complex mathematical concepts with internal and external stakeholders such as risk managers, senior management and regulators.
Perform quantitative analysis and facilitate understanding of the risk for a variety of financial derivatives, including exotic products.
Provide supervision and quantitative / technical guidance to more junior risk management professionals.
In performing his/her job function, a Vice President in Risk Strats will have the following opportunities:
Broad exposure to stress testing, pricing, and capital models for a variety of financial products and risk stripes
Exposure to and development of cutting-edge financial mathematics tools and techniques.
Development of pricing and simulation models across asset classes, notably for interest rate, equities, commodities, funding, FX, and credit derivatives.
Development of quantitative and programming skills as well as product and market knowledge.
Dynamic teamwork environment.
Qualifications:
Strong quantitative skills with an advanced degree (Ph.D. or Master's with relevant experience) in a quantitative discipline (Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics, Econometrics etc.)
Excellent command of mathematics, modeling and numerical techniques. Good knowledge of statistics, econometric modelling and probability theory.
Strong programming skills and experience with an object oriented programming language (Java, C++ etc.).
Strong written and verbal communication skills – ability to explain complex quantitative concepts to a non-technical audience

At Goldman Sachs, we commit our people, capital and ideas to help our clients, shareholders and the communities we serve to grow. Founded in 1869, we are a leading global investment banking, securities and investment management firm. Headquartered in New York, we maintain offices around the world.

c2cc007af7fe27a2.title: BI Engineer (6 month FTC)
c2cc007af7fe27a2.description:
What's Happening?

As the communications landscape continues to shift towards increasing reliance on data-led insights, we are now looking for a BI/Analytics Engineer for a 6 months FTC to join our team in order to meet increased demand from our clients. In this role, you will join our London based EMEA Analytics Hub, starting remotely for now.

You will be joining an eclectic bunch of people

In the analytics team, we have diverse backgrounds and expertise, speak many languages and love to bring this variety to the work we deliver.

We channel our positive attitude, critical thinking and analytical mind-sets to solve our client's problems, provide inputs into strategy and see opportunities not visible without data and insights. Depending on scope and requirements we work together or individually to identify insight from large (using SQL, Python, NLP and/or machine learning) and small data (using research and panels).

What will you be doing?

Design and implement pipelines and dashboards to monitor and assess performance of mobile apps – using raw mobile app data from Firebase and BigQuery (SQL) to create new derived tables that can be used for visualisation, setting up GCP cloud functions in Python to schedule processes and visualise results in Tableau
Automate social media reports aimed at assessing content performance – building small software in Python to ingest data from APIs, setting up GCP cloud functions in Python to schedule processes and pushing outputs in GSheets / BigQuery
Use APIs and write small software to retrieve 3rd party data programmatically
Implement process improvements and code enhancements to help analysts streamline their workflow
Building visualisation dashboards in DataStudio or Tableau tailored to client needs
Collaborate across project teams within the department

Who are you?

Minimum 3+ years' experience in business intelligence, analytics and software development, building data pipelines and small software to ingest data from APIs as well as manipulating and auditing data to create customer insights
Experience with APIs (particularly Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, Sprinklr, Brandwatch APIs) and reports automation
Advanced knowledge of Python and SQL / BigQuery
Reporting capabilities, with ability to define KPIs and metrics, and experience delivering insights using Tableau or DataStudio

Skills Desirable:

Knowledge of cloud technologies such as GCP and AWS is highly appreciated
Knowledge of digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics

Note From The Talent Team

We appreciate the time taken to apply for the role and your recent interest in Weber Shandwick. We will review all applications and be in touch with those who have been shortlisted to the next stage. Unfortunately, due to the volume of applications we are not able to get back to everyone individually hence, if you haven't heard from us, on this occasion your application has not been successful and we wish you all the best in your search.


#LI-LW1

ce364b8abbb40da3.title: SQL Test Engineer
ce364b8abbb40da3.description:
Branch/Department:
Technology, Savings & Digital (Change)
Location:
Head Office - Sovereign Street (Leeds)

Permanent

c.£35,000

Flexible working arrangements

35
Are you an experienced SQL Test Engineer looking for the next step in your career and the opportunity to own a platform, challenge current ways of working and progress the platform?

Do you want to be able to say “I did that”?

If so, we have the position for you. And not only that, we have just renewed our hybrid working model, so you can work 60% from home (if you wish!) and the rest of your time can be spent in our brand new, modern, energy efficient Head Office in the heart of Leeds, where you get free tea and coffee every day!

You will have full accountability and responsibility for the testing of this particular platform, so you will need to get your sleeves rolled up and get stuck into the testing straight away, and you will need to be self-motivated, driven and organised.

You will need excellent communication skills and the ability to challenge the ways of working and present new ideas to the senior team.

You'll also need:

Exposure to established testing tools such as ReadyAPI Test (SoapUI Pro).
Exposure to non-functional testing such as performance testing.
Experience of UI automation using Selenium WebDriver with SpecFlow.
Experience of working in a .NET or Java environment.
Understanding of C# programming language

Here are a few reasons why you might be interested in joining us…

Our team and business are centered around community, people and society. You will be surrounded by people who are experts at what they do and are committed to helping you (and the society) achieve your aims.
We have no time for hierarchy; you'll own your work, be accountable, collaborative, trusted and your ideas will be heard. We employ talented people who care about eachother and the work they do, so you will need to be a good team player, self-motivated, proactive and customer orientated.
We are changing, we are growing and we will need you to get stuck in. Your role will be challenging, interesting and demanding and has the scope to develop as quickly as you do. You will have an excellent leader who is committed to your progression.
We talk about ‘members', not ‘customers'. And there's never a mention of ‘shareholders'. This is because Leeds Building Society is proudly a mutual society. We are owned by our members, the people who have mortgages and savings with us and that's how we've worked for 140 years
We have the cycle to work scheme, provide discounted travel and parking, an excellent bonus structure and you can even buy extra holiday days.

Ultimately you will be joining a business which has grown significantly in the past 2 years, has ambitious expansion targets and continues to invest in its transformation projects and people.

Interested? Why wait? Apply Now.

243b19b54cc7e02b.title: BI Engineer
243b19b54cc7e02b.description:
THG is a fast-moving, global technology business that specialises in taking brands direct to consumers. Our world-class proprietary tech and infrastructure powers our extensive portfolio of beauty, nutrition and lifestyle brands and is now helping drive exponential growth of our clients' brands globally.

We're powered by a global team of over 10,000 ambitious people around the world. Our culture is fast-paced and entrepreneurial, it's this DNA that has supported our incredible growth.

We're always looking for individuals that can bring fresh and innovative thinking to THG, and play a part in driving the group forward on its exciting journey. So, if you're ready to take the next big step in your career, challenge yourself every day and evolve with the world around you, THG is ready for you.
About The Hut Group:

THG is one of the world's fastest growing and largest online retailers. We have over a decade of experience building and growing brands in the Beauty and Wellness sectors, in over 160 markets. We create brilliant digital brand experiences and our in-house team design, develop and build a bespoke proprietary technology platform that is used by hundreds of millions of people worldwide.


With a world-class business, a proprietary technology platform, and disruptive business model, our ambition is to be the global digital leader.


Our culture is fast-paced and ambitious - we like to move twice as fast others believe to be possible. This belief is a fundamental part of the DNA that has supported our incredible growth. Our people are our strength and we have over 4,000 diverse, smart thinkers across the globe who are encouraged to think creatively and empowered to turn their ideas into actions.

To support our ambitious growth, we are looking for commercially astute, ambitious individuals that can bring fresh and innovative thinking to THG and play a part in driving the Group forward on its truly exciting journey.


THG Technology:

Technology is at the heart of the business, core to the growth and internationalisation of all brands that sit under the THG umbrella. Our platform currently supports 177 international sites, in 47 different languages and 23 payment methods. From hosting, all the way through to logistics, we power it all through efficient and scalable technology which has been developed in house! With 600 technologists globally, we are squarely focussed on bigger ideas with innovation, creativity and outside of the box thinking. We look for individuals with a passion for creating robust and cutting edge systems that help our business' and our clients grow their ecommerce presence.


About the Role:

As a BI Engineer you will have the task of delivering high-quality software and highly performing software systems within an Agile environment. You will be a pivotal part of our Business Intelligence and Data function, implementing best practices and aiding the wider team to deliver great solutions.


Responsibilities

Provide analytical and development skills across a range of business areas, producing timely documentation and ensuring proposed solutions are fit for purpose.
Provide ad-hoc analysis and reports as required.
Adhere to team standards for processes and documentation.
Proactively improve existing skills, taking on new technical skills as appropriate, and continuously seek to expand business knowledge.
Conduct thorough analysis and diagnosis of problems.
Monitor evolving IT trends and business requirements, working with third parties to identify and assess appropriate tools/solutions as required.


Criteria

Proven experience developing Business Intelligence solutions and developing data warehouses.
A solid understanding of working with large data sets
A solid understanding of ETL / ELT processes
Proven ability to perform effective analysis on large scale projects, providing realistic estimates and timescales as part of the analysis.
Ability to influence and communicate effectively (verbal and written) with others across the business, and externally, at all levels.
Work well under pressure, able to prioritise and multi-task to meet deadlines.
Ability to cope with a fast-paced environment where priorities change to meet business needs.
Work effectively both individually and as part of a team.
Educated to degree level or equivalent.
Preferably Finance or Logistics industry experience.


Technical Experience Required

Understanding of database design and development
Understanding of dimensional modelling and how this can be applied in a business environment
3+ years experience working with the Microsoft BI Suite (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)
2+ years experience developing with BI reporting tools. i.e. tableau, qlik, power BI. SSRS
Experience using, managing and creating code repositories.
Strong T-SQL


Technical Experience Desired

Ability to understand infrastructure topology in Multi Data Centre environment
Basic understanding of administration of SQL server instance (server maintenance, backups, monitoring server performance) within high availability environment.
Experience with other programming languages e.g python, java, .NET
Experience working with REST API's
Experience creating, configuring and deploying web services within Windows and Linux
Experience working with queue-based systems (RabbitMQ, Kafka, ActiveMQ)
Experience working with big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark, Hive)


What's in it for you?

Competitive salary
Onsite Doctor
Employee discounts
Company bonus scheme
Company Pension Scheme
Because of the high volumes of applications our opportunities attract, it sometimes takes us time to review and consider them all. We endeavour to respond to every application we receive within 14 days. If you haven't heard from us within that time frame or should you have any specific questions about this or other applications for positions at THG please contact one of our Talent team to discuss further.

THG is committed to creating a diverse & inclusive environment and hence welcomes applications from all sections of the community.

1e0dfc128a4a6ac2.title: Junior Business Intelligence Engineering Specialist
1e0dfc128a4a6ac2.description:
Kraken IM is an award-winning tech start-up based in Middlesbrough. We build tools for some of the world’s largest engineering companies all over the world to ensure they get the data they need to complete their products and meet their challenges towards net-zero carbon.

We are seeking a talented and detail focussed BI specialist to work closely with the existing team and help develop and shape how we leverage data within Kraken IM.

You will have the opportunity to make your mark utilising cutting edge technologies and processes throughout the whole data lifecycle. The successful applicant will be working in unison closely with the team and our customers so there is huge potential to broaden your experience also learn from some successful and highly experienced individuals.

You’ll be using both our existing Kraken tools and BI processes and tools to work with and generate useful insights by transforming and wrangling engineering data.

Tasks

We are looking for an enthusiastic junior BI specialist/analyst to join our team. You will report directly to the management team. Your primary focus will be to gather, exploit and transform our client data. There will be a large element of transforming and mapping engineering data.


Extract live data from the systems and convert data into meaningful and actionable insights
Apply and transform naming in customer data to engineering standards
Implementing, delivering and maintaining effective business intelligence solutions and dashboards
Ability to work independently and be proactive in seeing work through to completion
Maintain and develop own skills, knowledge and capability to an appropriate level to fulfil the role

Requirements


Exceptional Excel and experience with Data Visualisation - PowerBI is preferable
Self-motivated and dynamic with the ability to consistently work towards tight deadlines and prioritise effectively in accordance with business needs
Knowledge of databases and operating systems
Ability to learn new software and technologies quickly

It would be awesome if you had experience with some, or all, of the following but again, this is a junior role so if you don't then that's not an issue. We're more interested in your mindset and enthusiasm than a specific experience for this role.


Basic engineering knowledge for the process sector in particular around equipment or construction
Understanding of lifecycle analysis for greenhouse gas emissions
Have a passion for decarbonisation

Benefits


Flexibility in both location and working hours
Relaxed atmosphere
Competitive salary £25-30k depending on experience
Great benefits

This is an excellent career progression opportunity – we’re still a young company so you have a chance to grow and develop alongside the company and you’ll get the opportunity to be involved in our decisions. This is an opportunity to broaden your skillset, work on projects all over the world in an exciting new space.

4e12e576cf6687f4.title: Analytics Quant Solutions Engineer- Asset Management
4e12e576cf6687f4.description:
Some careers have more impact than others.
If you’re looking for a career where you can make a real impression, join HSBC and discover how valued you’ll be.
Retail Banking and Wealth Management serves more than 50 million customers worldwide with a complete range of banking and wealth management services to enable them to manage their finances and protect and build their financial futures. It is a global business that brings together management responsibility for Retail Banking, Wealth Management, Insurance and Asset Management with a focus on customer-centric propositions and innovative and efficient distribution channels.
We are currently seeking an ambitious individual to join our team as a HSBC Analytics Quant Solutions Engineer, working together with colleagues to define, manage and achieve divisional business targets.
Role Purpose
The Global Analytics team are seeking highly analytical, self-driven and intellectual individuals to support the investment functions within HSBC’s Global Asset Management arm. The newly formed team will be an extension to the London and Paris based group and be independently responsible for the production and support of comprehensive statistical analysis, design and interpretation of core products across all global investment strategies. The team will oversee all strategies across active equities, fixed income and multi asset.
In this role, you will:
Define Portfolio Analytics Architecture: Identifies and standardizes the use and governance of data and analytics. This includes the governance of data and algorithms used for portfolio analysis and construction, risk modelling, pricing modelling, analytics applications and automated decision-making.
Take of ownership of Dash enterprise platform.
Take of ownership HSBC Analytics Quant Lab studio platform support.
Working closely with the solutions engineers team to translate business requirements into analytics tasks and ultimately into production code for high throughput, real time automated analytics.
Take ownership of the maintenance and development of our data quality validation process.
Partner with our Data Engineering team to build requirements for data infrastructure necessary to facilitate efficient analytics building.
Requirements
To be successful in the role, you should meet the following requirements:
Good academic records preferably with specialisation in finance from an analytics background in a portfolio analytics, or investment risk systems support role.
Working knowledge of following platforms:
Dash Enterprise platform
Python Ecosystem
Financial Big Data modelling with at least 3 years of experiences
Have at least 3 years of relevant experience with GCP.
Very good command in English and highly articulate in communications.
Pro-active, self-driven and positive attitude coupled with the ability to multi-task and deliver under pressure and high problem-solving aptitude.
The ability to work and think as a team is crucial.
Eager to constantly improve and learn new skills.
You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.

7705be48667e23c6.title: Analytics Engineer
7705be48667e23c6.description:
As an Analytics Engineer in our Business Intelligence Team, you will have an opportunity to impact all elements of the business – Customer Experience, Product, Retail, Marketing, Finance and Operations. It is our goal to ensure everyone in the business has access to accurate, up-to-date modelled data that can enable sophisticated decision making.
You will work with our Business Intelligence Lead to ensure that stakeholders across the company have access to the best data, analysis and comprehensive visualised reports in a timely fashion.

You will be working on a data pipeline that utilises the industry’s most state-of-the-art tools. Our stack is Github, Fivetran, Stitch, Airflow, DBT, Snowflake and Looker. There will be a significant amount of autonomy, and you will take ownership of a considerable part of Patch’s data analytics, engineering and reporting.

ABOUT THE COMPANY
Patch is a modern plant shop for modern plant people. Patch helps you discover the best plants for your space, delivers them to your door and enables you to look after them.

Having attracted over 450,000 customers with a 4.9/5 rating on Trustpilot and 280,000 plant fans on Instagram, we recently came 27th in Deloitte Fast 50 and raised over £7m in venture funding to scale rapidly across the UK and Western Europe.

As more of us choose to live in big towns and cities, we’re leading busy, stressful lives, and our need for nature is growing. We believe that by bringing plants into your home or workplace, life becomes much calmer, healthier and more joyful.
There’s a perception that plants are hard work; it’s a mission to find places that deliver plants, it’s difficult to choose the right plants for your space, and it’s a pain to look after them - but it doesn't have to be this way.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Data modelling: Build SQL models to join Patch’s numerous data sources together and define Patch’s business logic on top of that data in DBT
Data engineering: Design and develop efficient data pipelines and models that power internal analytics

Looker modelling: Use Looker’s internal language, LookML, to create metrics and ensure Patch has a best class Looker setup.

Dashboarding: Creating visualisations and dashboards for stakeholders across the business.

Analysis: Carry out analysis on Patch’s data to spot growth opportunities and identify issues before they become issues.

Data advocacy: Be an advocate for data within Patch, whether training up staff on our BI tools or being a tribune for data literacy.

Stakeholder management: Work with senior stakeholders to translate their needs into actionable insights, models and reports.
Documentation: Help improve and write Patch's data documentation and how-to guides.

Requirements:
Essential
Comfortable working from home and learning that way.
At least one year’s experience in a data or analytics-based role.
A passion for data and using data to solve a business’s problems.
Advanced Excel/Google Sheets user: able to understand and build complex spreadsheets.
You have strong SQL skills. You know the difference between a query that works and a query that performs.
Have experience writing analytical Python.
You have experience working with one of the following databases - Redshift, Snowflake, Big Query, Postgres, Firebolt or similar.
A quick learner who can dive into new tools and be comfortable working with them in next to no time.
Demonstrable ability to solve problems and translate stakeholders needs into business insights.
You are happy to combine small ad-hoc tasks with big overarching quarterly tasks.

Nice to have
You have previously worked in the e-commerce space.
You have built out dashboards in Looker before and are comfortable working with LookML.
You have worked with DBT before.
You’re comfortable working in the command line and comfortable with a basic GIT workflow.

Benefits:
Competitive salary
Flexible working, we have two set days in the office, Wednesday and Thursday, you can work wherever you want on the other days
WFH allowance to make sure you have everything you need
25 days holiday plus bank holidays
Pension plan
An opportunity to bring online one of the world’s last remaining offline industries
£600 a year plant allowance + family and friends discount
Coaching/mentoring budget to help you with your development
Healthcare support via Equipsme
Patch offers many team-wide benefits and perks but if there’s something important to you that’s not on this list, let us know

We encourage applications from all backgrounds, communities and industries, and are committed to having a team that is made up of diverse skills, experiences and abilities. We actively encourage BAME, disabled, LGBTQIA+ candidates and those from a low-income background, to apply and value the positive impact that difference has on our teams. We are committed to equality and diversity within our workforce and all opportunities provided by Patch.

THE COMPANY:

You will:
Act as 3rd line support for clients for visualisation products.
Act as a cross-departmental Visualisation Engineer to deliver portfolios of Tableau dashboards across the business
Assist with the development of an Analytics and ML suite for the business
Support the client delivery of visualisation products
Work collaboratively with key stakeholders and Engineers to optimise the visualisation capability.
REQUIREMENTS:

3ffc0739479ec6e4.title: Senior Analytics Engineer
3ffc0739479ec6e4.description:
About Us
Here at Gousto, we are on a mission to become the UK's favourite way to eat dinner!
Whether it is creating diversity in our recipes or building new teams, we care about our people and the opportunities they have at Gousto.
We are committed to equality of opportunity across our organisation. At all levels we promote equality, ensuring our people are consistently treated in a fair and equal manner.
If you need reasonable adjustments at any point in the application or interview process, please let us know.
In your application, please feel free to note which pronouns you use (For example - she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).
Go Gousto!
Senior Data Analytics Engineer
Data has been at the heart of our business from the start. We have multiple data products in production, delivering real, measurable ROI. Examples include algorithms to optimise picking in our warehouse as well as our recipe recommendation engine that drives menu conversion. In addition, data is used throughout our teams to make critical decisions at all levels of the organisation.
We invested into our data infrastructure early on in our journey. This is built using Airflow, Snowplow, Kinesis, Athena etc. and is the backbone to many data products - from ML algorithms to BI reporting.
Now we are looking for a skilled Data Analytics engineer with the knowledge to implement data modelling across the business to help us deliver self-serve diagnostics capabilities.
You’ll be a bridge between data engineering and end users, partnering with cross functional teams across the business to comprehend their data needs. You will influence through providing the right data in the right structure to enable self-serve analytics capabilities.
If you’re a natural problem solver and are passionate about data, you’ll fit right in.
What Will Keep You Busy
Team up with end users across the business to comprehend their data needs and model tables using best practices to ensure the timely delivery of high quality data optimised for self-serve.
Work closely with BI and Product Analytics teams to standardise and unify metrics as well as build their single source of truth across various dimensions in a scalable way to enable flexible slicing and dicing.
Partner with Data Engineers to collect data from new sources, strengthen our foundational data models and advocate for and emphasise the business value.
Coach technical and non-technical users on SQL best practices and efficient querying.
Help to design, build and maintain a suite of visual dashboards.
Contribute to the development of the Product Analytics function and optimisation of our event-focused analytics.
Requirements
Who You Are
Exposure in a similar business intelligence or data analysis role.
You'll have significant knowledge in data modelling and in conducting ETL/ELT with large and complex data sets.
You love SQL - writing efficient SQL queries and programming languages (Python preferably).
You have a delivery mindset and ability to work in a fast paced, high growth organisation.
You have great communication skills, whether to your team, to business stakeholders or to our management team.
You are a high-energy self-starter with a passion for data, attention to detail, and a positive attitude.
Benefits
Click here to see our benefits!

4e48f95c12d3e7a9.title: Business Analyst - Zego - Finance Engineering - Platform
4e48f95c12d3e7a9.description:
We are Zego - a commercial motor insurance provider that powers opportunities for businesses, from entire fleets of vehicles to self-employed drivers and riders. We combine best-in-class technology with sophisticated data sources to offer insurance products that save businesses time and money.
Since our inception, we have believed that the problem with traditional insurance is that it holds businesses back. It’s too expensive and time consuming, and it no longer suits businesses who use vehicles to earn money. Our products represent a solution to this problem for businesses based across the UK, Europe and beyond.
So far, we have raised over $200 million in funding and we were the first UK insurtech to be valued at over $1 billion. We were also the first to be awarded our own insurance license and recently won Tech Company of the Year 2020.
At Zego, we are proud to say we have a diverse and inclusive team, unified by our shared values and mission. Our people are the most important part of our story and everybody at Zego, no matter their role, has an integral part to play.
Overview of the team
The platform team focuses on the long term scalability of Zego’s core policy and product models, shared services, claims, pricing, integrations and finance systems, as well as the horizontal enablers of our B2B and B2C teams. As Zego grows the team will be focused on moving services out of the current monolith, and ensuring that we have scalability baked into everything that we build. The team is rapidly growing, and it’s an exciting time to join.
Role overview
This role will sit in the product team and be focussed on researching and informing the development of the Zego Platform. The Zego Platform is a smart, scalable and flexible core for the business, made up of a set of services, providing the building blocks for quickly developing, launching and managing insurance products. We're building a software platform that will allow Zego to define, launch, market and manage insurance products and support customers.
You’ll be providing industry insights and carrying out key research and analysis work to ensure that Zego are delivering the best possible technical products. Working closely with senior leaders in Finance, and directly alongside Product Managers and Technical Leads, you’ll have strong knowledge and understanding of domain modelling and technical service development.
About the role
You will be taking responsibility for research and analysis in Zego’s Platform Finance Engineering team. The Finance engineering team is responsible for delivering an accurate, reliable and scalable financial system that provides billing, payments, balances and data for financial reporting
You will be working with strong engineering teams, complete with a Tech Lead, Staff Engineer and Engineering Managers for support
You will work closely with stakeholders and the engineering team to identify and develop new product opportunities that enhance and expand Zego’s platform capabilities
You will identify areas of product development that require external research and validation, and bring this work and knowledge to the product development process
You will update work in progress in collaboration with the team, and provide support to prepare work to be done with detail for engineering to understand
You will collaborate with product, service design and engineering teams, providing strategic insights across the teams you work with to ensure that all functions are able to make well-informed decisions on product development and prioritisation
About you
You have knowledge of the insurance industry
Preferred knowledge of Finance and processes, although not required
You will have an understanding of what it means to be developing systems for an international insurance business
You are ideally technically savvy, able to work closely with Product Managers and Engineers
You have knowledge of what it means to work within an agile Product team
You demonstrate value through building data-driven products, driven by thorough understanding of the domain area
You are analytical and able to draw extensive insights from qualitative and quantitative data
What it's like to work @ Zego
Zego has a truly international and inclusive team, unified by great ideas and collaborative thoughtfulness. Our people are the most important part of our story and everyone plays an essential role in our journey. We look for people who have expertise, enthusiasm and who are motivated by change. There’s plenty of room to learn and grow, as part of our ongoing training programmes or directly from other experts. You’ll work alongside a talented group of people who respect each other's differences and seek to understand fresh perspectives.

555fbf42d1e71621.title: Principal Investigator, Quantitative Systems Pharmacology Engineer
555fbf42d1e71621.description:
Site Name: USA - Pennsylvania - Upper Providence, UK - Hertfordshire - Stevenage
Posted Date: Feb 21 2022
The Systems Modeling and Translational Biology (SMTB) department is seeking Quantitative Systems Pharmacology (QSP) Engineer at Principal Investigator level, passionate about using advanced mathematical modeling linked with artificial intelligence and machine learning approaches to inform key decisions in drug discovery and development.
The SMTB group uses mathematical modeling and simulation to address the relationships between drug properties, its disposition and the pharmacological and toxicological response to translate from in-vitro and in-vivo preclinical species to humans. This involves the integration and interpretation of data from many sources to help drive project decisions.
Working in a dynamic, multidisciplinary environment the successful candidate will develop, calibrate and use Quantitative Systems Pharmacology and Toxicology models of the relevant biological processes that link target modulation to clinical outcomes, link them to physiological based pharmacokinetics model (PBPK) for various delivery routes and leverage machine learning approaches (AI/ML) to provide actionable support for project decisions in drug discovery and development.
This position is an exciting opportunity to make a positive difference in the lives of patients by focusing the right targets, right drugs and the right patients.
Responsibilities:
Develop QSP/QST models and apply them to impact the progression of drug development programs
Leverage existing and develop new PBPK models for various delivery routes and modalities and link them with the QSP and QST models to impact the progression of drug development programs
Develop Target Pharmacology Assessments to inform discovery programs
Further evolve modeling approaches for maximizing the positive impact on projects
Peer review modeling work from colleagues as appropriate, insuring high quality standards for the modeling work
Build, expand and refine the modeling capabilities and software platforms of SMTB
Exceptional collaborative behaviors to build and maintain relationships across R&D
Promote and increase the reputation of the modeling internally within R&D and externally including regulatory agencies
Why you?
Basic Qualifications:
We are looking for professionals with these required skills to achieve our goals:
Advanced degree in chemical, mechanical or biomedical engineering, physics, applied mathematics, scientific computing or related field
4 years of experience in applying mechanism based mathematical modeling techniques in life sciences
Experience in building, validating and using complex, system level models of biological systems
Core competency in numerical analysis focusing on differential equations and parameter optimization.
Working knowledge of statistical and machine knowledge approaches
Expertise in scientific computing and programming - in particular Matlab and Simbiology
Experience building and using Quantitative Systems Pharmacology/Toxicology (QSP/QST), PBPK or mechanistic PK/PD models
Experience in influencing decisions and experimental design by using appropriate modeling approaches that integrate all available data
Experience in linking QSP/QST models with mechanistic drug pharmacokinetics
Experience working in cross functional / multi-disciplinary teams
Preferred Qualifications:
If you have the following characteristics, it would be a plus:
PhD
Experience in linking QSP/T modeling with ‘omics data and big data analytics and machine learning
Experience building and using QSP/QST, PBPK and mechanistic PK/PD models
Knowledge and understanding of drug delivery, absorption, distribution and metabolism, pharmacology and toxicology, PK/PD modeling, physiological based modeling and translational sciences
Familiarity with the challenges of drug discovery and forward thinking with respect to the general application of mathematical models in discovery and development
Scientific curiosity and demonstrated ability to learn
Evidence of identifying, developing, and applying innovative solutions to scientific and technological problems faced in systems modeling
Excellent written and oral communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with scientists in other disciplines with a positive, collegial, collaborative attitude
Why GSK?
Our values and expectations are at the heart of everything we do and form an important part of our culture.
These include Patient focus, Transparency, Respect, Integrity along with Courage, Accountability, Development, and Teamwork. As GSK focuses on our values and expectations and a culture of innovation, performance, and trust, the successful candidate will demonstrate the following capabilities:
Operating at pace and agile decision-making – using evidence and applying judgement to balance pace, rigour and risk.
Committed to delivering high quality results, overcoming challenges, focusing on what matters, execution.
Continuously looking for opportunities to learn, build skills and share learning.
Sustaining energy and well-being
Building strong relationships and collaboration, honest and open conversations.
Budgeting and cost-consciousnessLI-GSK
If you require an accommodation or other assistance to apply for a job at GSK, please contact the GSK Service Centre at 1-877-694-7547 (US Toll Free) or +1 801 567 5155 (outside US).
GSK is an Equal Opportunity Employer and, in the US, we adhere to Affirmative Action principles. This ensures that all qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, age, disability, genetic information, military service, covered/protected veteran status or any other federal, state or local protected class.
At GSK, the health and safety of our employees are of paramount importance. As a science-led healthcare company on a mission to get ahead of disease together, we believe that supporting vaccination against COVID-19 is the single best thing we can do in the US to ensure the health and safety of our employees, complementary workers, workplaces, customers, consumers, communities, and the patients we serve.
GSK has made the decision to require all US employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19, where allowed by state or local law and where vaccine supply is readily available. The only exceptions to this requirement are employees who are approved for an accommodation for religious, medical or disability-related reasons.
Important notice to Employment businesses/ Agencies
GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
Please note that if you are a US Licensed Healthcare Professional or Healthcare Professional as defined by the laws of the state issuing your license, GSK may be required to capture and report expenses GSK incurs, on your behalf, in the event you are afforded an interview for employment. This capture of applicable transfers of value is necessary to ensure GSK’s compliance to all federal and state US Transparency requirements. 3bd50262805e490c.title: Senior Business Intelligence Engineer
3bd50262805e490c.description:
The revolution in modern advertising won't be televised. It will be streamed.


Roku is changing how the world watches TV


Roku is the #1 TV streaming platform in the US, and we've set our sights on powering every television in the world. Roku pioneered streaming to the TV. Our mission is to be the TV streaming platform that connects the entire TV ecosystem. We connect consumers to the content they love, enable content publishers to build and monetize large audiences, and provide advertisers unique capabilities to engage consumers.


From your first day at Roku, you'll make a valuable — and valued — contribution. We're a fast-growing public company where no one is a bystander. We offer you the opportunity to delight millions of TV streamers worldwide while gaining meaningful experience across various disciplines.


About the role


Roku pioneered streaming to the TV and continues to innovate and lead the industry. While we are well-positioned to help shape the future of television – including TV advertising – around the world, continued success relies on its investment in our data.


At Roku, data is at the center of everything we do. At Roku's scale, the depth and richness of our data help us uncover insights to improve our users' everyday experience. That's why we're actively looking for a Senior Business Intelligence Engineer (BIE) to play an instrumental role in helping Roku continue its success by providing end-to-end business intelligence solutions that democratize data across the business. You will work closely with analysts, data engineers, and business stakeholders to understand business questions, as well as write robust pipelines to create analytical data assets, and use visualization to create informative reports and dashboards that allow stakeholders to answer questions quickly and with confidence. You will become an expert in our data infrastructure and create/maintain pipelines critical to conducting robust analyses. The ideal candidate for this role loves building tools and reports that empower others to make high-impact decisions and tell stories with data.


This is not an "order-taking" role. You won't take marching orders from business owners and execute on ad-hoc questions. Instead, you will proactively identify the areas that require attention and formulate analyses, insights, and recommendations based on an excellent command of the needs. We expect you to play an instrumental role in helping Roku continue its success by providing insightful segmentation and platform and behavioral trends. More than having strong technical abilities to retrieve, manipulate, analyze, and visualize data and excellent communication capabilities. One of the key requirements of the role is to collaborate with stakeholders and satisfies immediate business needs. The position is a perfect fit for anyone who wants to continue to evolve business domain expertise alongside technical and analytical development.
What you'll be doing

Work directly with analysts and engineers to understand goals, gather requirements, and guide development of new data assets by producing robust feature guides
Build and support robust data pipelines to support business tools and analytical needs and meet SLAs
Conduct UAT on new tables
Liaise with data engineers to communicate, plan, and execute to mitigate any adverse impacts of underlying data changes.
Manage a backlog of planned and ad-hoc requests weighing the relative impact and effort of each item.
Serve as the resident expert in understanding the nuance of our data infrastructure for the analytics team. You will be the go-to-person when questions arise around the correct dataset, proper joins, bugs, etc.
Create reports, dashboards, visualizations, and self-service tools that help partners monitor business trends and key metrics
Build robust data pipelines to support business tools and analytical needs
Monitor key metrics and business processes to identify trends and uncover root causes that drive business impact.


We're excited if you have

5 years of relevant work experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Technical Operations
Expert ability SQL, Python, and ETL using big data tools (HIVE/Presto, Redshift)
Experience Expertise writing performant and reliable data pipelines. Experience in Airflow preferred.
Fluency in Looker
Fluency in common data visualizations libraries in R or Python
Expert understanding of data warehousing principles, pipelines, and APIs
Strong communication skills
The ability to work independently and across multiple time zones
Ownership mindset- you own the end-to-end lifecycle of a product starting from ideation to adoption and maintenance.


The Roku culture


Roku is a great place for people who want to work in a fast-paced environment where everyone is focused on the company's success rather than their own. We try to surround ourselves with people who are great at their jobs, who are easy to work with, and who keep their egos in check. We appreciate a sense of humor. We believe a fewer number of very talented folks can do more for less cost than a larger number of less talented teams. We're independent thinkers with big ideas who act boldly, move fast and accomplish extraordinary things through collaboration and trust. In short, at Roku you'll be part of a company that's changing how the world watches TV.

3cbd822330a27684.title: Growth Engineer, Marketing Analytics
3cbd822330a27684.description:
We're the people behind WordPress.com, Tumblr, Jetpack, and WooCommerce. We're looking for Growth Engineers to come join us on the MarTech (Marketing Technology) team for WordPress.com.

The team makes growth, and the analysis of growth, more effective and more efficient. We use tools and technology to encourage ideas, tackle sophisticated problems through team initiatives across all of Automattic, and most importantly, drive growth of the business through rapid experimentation.

We're a relatively new and rapidly growing team with the opportunity to drive substantial change! We need a marketing analytics specialist to join us who can experiment with creative ideas and help us tackle sophisticated business problems.

Key Responsibilities
Work with a growing, cross-functional, and highly collaborative engineering team to unlock the potential of WordPress.com's marketing technology stack, and the teams who use it across the whole company.
You will own data ingestion for all marketing analytics, including, but not limited to, pageviews tracking, event tracking, conversion tracking, paid media conversions, affiliate referrals, and peer referrals.
Be the top tier specialist in marketing analytics (data ingestion), including AMP analytics, GDPR, user privacy, cookies, localStorage, browser privacy features, and security initiatives.
Learn our existing platform landscape and find ways to enhance our marketing analytics platform and improve data integrity. You'll also build and maintain automated tests that monitor the health of marketing analytics.
Be responsible for crafting comprehensive documentation (internal field guide articles) that effectively enable self-serve use of our marketing analytics platform.
You
Have 5+ years of practical hands-on experience in full-stack web development using PHP/MySQL/JavaScript. You've worked with REST APIs, and you're strong on best practices for security and performance.
Have 5+ years of marketing analytics, marketing operations, or digital marketing experience. Experience in Google Analytics , Google Tag Manager, Segment, or other marketing analytics or customer data platform. Experience with data visualization tools. Advanced in Microsoft Excel. Excellent analytical skills and ability to provide meaningful insights from data.
Have experience using agile development tools (e.g., GitHub, Trello). You know how to break big problems down into smaller pieces. You thrive on moving items to the Done column at a healthy pace.
Highly collaborative, you love participating in code reviews, and you enjoy spirited discussions about architecture, design, user privacy, and performance. You're also comfortable working with others who are not engineers. You're confident, a great listener, and you seek to simplify the sophisticated.
Love to experiment and tackle problems. You're product-minded, growth-focused, and oriented to details. You're happy to question assumptions and back your recommendations with data.
Extra Credit
Startup experience; e.g., you've been a technical founder, co-founder, growth specialist, or have worked with a marketing team before.
Experience building or supporting sites powered by WordPress, or WordPress theme or plugin development.
Experience with a JavaScript library like React, or a superset of JavaScript (e.g., TypeScript).
Experience with Looker - a data modeling tool.
Experience with Hadoop, Hue (Impala/Hive queries).
Having worked with affiliate program software (e.g., iDevAffiliate, CJ, Impact Radius, ShareASale, WP Affiliate, etc.), or peer referral software.
Knowledge of data visualization tools.
Experience with automated test frameworks, Selenium, Puppeteer, PHPUnit, Jest, Mocha, Circle CI, Travis, CI, Jenkins, or other.
Having experience in languages other than PHP/JS, such as Python.
Email marketing experience is a plus; e.g., Iterable, MailChimp, AWeber.
Experience in paid search; e.g., Google Ads (AdWords), or Bing.
Experience working with Google Ads Scripts for automation.
Having worked with or as a social media marketing company.
How to Apply

Does this sound exciting? If yes, click the Apply button below and fill out our application form. Let us know what you can contribute to the team. We are lucky to receive many applications for this position, so try to make your application stand out.

Please include an answer to at least one of the following mini-challenges in your cover letter. Applicants who do not submit their cover letter will not be considered.

Mini Challenge 1

When you make a GET request to: https://public-api.wordpress.com/wpcom/v2/work-with-us with a header of X-future: automattician you will receive a secret. What is that secret?

Mini Challenge 2

<?php

$a=['Automattia','WordPresq','Jetpaci','WooCommercc'];

// Add additional code that corrects the spelling of these

// popular brand names using the least amount of code possible.

About Automattic

We are the people behind WordPress.com, WooCommerce, Tumblr, Simplenote, Jetpack, Longreads, Day One, PocketCasts, and more. We believe in making the web a better place.

We're a distributed company with more than 1900 Automatticians in 96 countries speaking 120+ different languages. We democratize publishing and commerce so anyone with a story can tell it, and anyone with a product can sell it, regardless of income, gender, politics, language, or country.

We believe in Open Source and the vast majority of our work is available under the GPL.

Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Automattic

We're improving diversity, equity, and inclusion in the tech industry. At Automattic, we want people to love their work and show respect and empathy to all. We welcome differences and strive to increase participation from traditionally underrepresented groups. Our DEI committee involves Automatticians across the company and drives grassroots change. For example, this group has helped facilitate private online spaces for affiliated Automatticians to gather and helps run a monthly DEI People Lab series for further learning. Diversity, Equity and Inclusion is a priority at Automattic, though our dedication influences far more than just Automatticians: We make our products freely available and translate our products into and offer customer support in numerous languages. We require unconscious bias training for our hiring teams and ensure our products are accessible across different bandwidths and devices. Learn more about our dedication to diversity, equity, and inclusion and our Employee Resource Groups.

Highways Engineer & Technical Business Analyst
Permanent, Full Time
Up to £46,359 per annum

The Highways and Transportation team over the coming years will strive to modernise the service, specifically around leveraging value from technology and raising customer engagement.
As well as being an experienced highways engineer, the Highways Engineer & Technical Business Analyst will also be expert in benchmarking and market testing and will be accountable for the development and delivery of the financial and commercial strategy that achieves service improvements, limits cost and grows revenue.
As an Engineer, this role will provide service and programme assurance, ensuring controls are in place to mark progress, manage budgets, risk and quality, to ensure services are delivered in line with policy and specification.
This role will require significant experience in a highways engineering field as well as delivering a benchmarking and market testing strategy, an ability to evaluate the business environment and introduce effective, efficient and cost-saving processes to deliver improvements in quality of service.
Evidence of working with complex statistical, financial and performance information, defining coherent baseline positions to inform budget modelling is essential.
Role responsibilities:
Responsible for provision of expertise in benchmarking as part of the Intelligent Client ethos, preparing and delivering a Benchmarking and Market Testing strategy, which drives improvement and innovation
Deliver financial savings to meet the Council’s Medium Term Resource Strategy (MTRS)
Work collaboratively with stakeholders to build compelling cost/benefit propositions for business cases, understanding complex, interdependent and wide-ranging business requirements of delivering quality public services.
Responsible for identifying and implementing business efficiencies to drive service improvements and secure the MTRS.
Horizon scan for exemplars and case studies of efficient highways delivery practice, with the ability to increase revenue drive change and deliver a financially sustainable service.
Deliver strong budgetary control and financial management.
To provide a first-class service to customers, and, to co-ordinate and deliver a range of highways services within the responsibility of the Commissioning team.
To support the Commissioning team managers with the development of strategic commercial issues and with the day to day management of the HST contract as appropriate.
To review and update as necessary the policies, standards and processes that apply to the Highways & Transportation Service, including the HST Contract Service Specification and Technical Specification
To provide highways engineering expertise and assist with the contribution to new practices and procedures to deliver efficiencies and respond to technological advances.
Assist with checking and approving supply chain partners, and with the auditing of services carried out for the Council, and the documentation relating to it
To assist with the preparation, design, planning programming and ordering of services within the responsibility of the Commissioning team
To ensure compliance with the Health & Safety policies of the Council and to ensure that the Construction (Design and Management) Regulations are fully applied to programme delivery
Skills, Knowledge and Experience:
Educated to degree level or appropriate professional qualification, or equivalent professional experience.
Evidence of continuing professional development, and knowledge in relevant professional area
Experience of delivering highways services with an ability to analyse and suggest mitigation consistent with the contract strategy.
Builds collaborative working relationships to aid effective negotiation and dispute resolution, and works collaboratively with HST partner to ensure delivery of highway services to a consistently high standard. This will involve influencing, persuading and matrix management to support Essex Highways employees meeting contract performance and efficiencies
Evidence of working with complex statistical, financial and performance information, defining coherent baseline positions to inform budget modelling.
Strong commercial skills with an ability to identify and maximise benefits from commercial opportunities.
Experience of driving and delivering sustainable change within a large complex organisation, to embed a climate of continuous improvement.
Significant experience in delivering a benchmarking and market testing strategy, evaluating the business environment and introducing effective, efficient and cost-saving processes to deliver improvements in quality of service.
As part of employment with Essex County Council should your role require a DBS check you will be required to register with the DBS update service. The DBS update service ensures all registered DBS certificates are kept up to date and allows authorised parties to view the status of your certificate. This is an annual subscription and you will be responsible for ensuring this is maintained. For further information on the DBS update service please visit: https://www.gov.uk/dbs-update-service
Essex County Council is proud to offer an excellent benefits package to all its employees. For more information please use the following link: https://www.workingforessex.com/working-here/pay-reward/
We seek the best talent from the widest pool of people as diversity is key to our success.
If you have queries on this role or require anything further, please email dean.millard@essex.gov.uk

aa703f2b58b1e313.title: BI Reporting Engineer
aa703f2b58b1e313.description:
My client, one of the world's leading speciality insurers, is looking for a BI Reporting Engineer to help them shift towards a product-centric operating model. This is a new hire and integral to their data transformation program. This business operates in 180 countries and underwrites more than 100 classes of speciality insurance. They have offices in the US, UK and Europe.
The successful BI Reporting Analyst will:
Develop, deploy and maintain BI interfaces, including query tools, data visualisation and interactive dashboards
Write SQL queries and functions in a sophisticated Data warehouse & relational database environment
Design complex data warehousing, advanced analytics and high impact business intelligence solutions
Establish design standards and best practices to optimize the performance and efficiency of the data warehousing environment. Review designs, and lead design review meetings.
The successful BI Reporting Analyst will likely have:
An in-depth understanding of database management systems, OLAP and ETL
The Ability to extract data across databases, cloud storage, and separate files filled with unstructured data
Experience with SQL, SSRS, SSIS and SSAS
Experience in a similar
Experience with AWS and Azure (desirable)
Keywords: Data Modelling, Business Intelligence, BI, SQL Server, Data Vault, Power BI, Insurance, DevOps, Financial Services
Eames Consulting is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

a6c0ec822a80b1b2.title: Analytics Engineer
a6c0ec822a80b1b2.description:
Live shows make us feel good. They’re a time to hang with our friends, discover new artists or lose ourselves on a dance floor. We’re on a mission to bring all of this to more fans, more often – and that’s where you come in.

We’re looking for an Analytics Engineer to join our data analytics team and ensure that data everybody can trust reaches every part of the business.

At DICE, you’ll be part of the company that’s redefining live entertainment. It's a place where you can be yourself, influence the culture, and create work that you’re proud of.

About the role

The analytics engineering team makes data easy to access, simple to understand, efficient to compile and reliably accurate. We work with a modern data stack, including dbt, Looker and Prefect, and a talented team of data engineers, data scientists and data analysts. You’ll be the person that understands every part of our data so that the team can extract maximum value from it.

You’ll be

Collaborating with data analysts and data engineers to build data models
Extending our existing Looker implementation to enable self-service data access and promote a data-led culture throughout the company
Testing data thoroughly to ensure confidence in our insights throughout the business
Improving efficiency of data warehousing and data lakes, minimising costs and maximising performance
Supporting our data scientists to make sure their machine learning models are easy to develop and accessible to the whole team
Making sure data is delivered to DICE products and other services we use to deliver the best experience for fans and partners

You are

A fan of music and culture
Accurate and attentive to detail
A good communicator
Wondering how you can get your queries to run more efficiently when you should be concentrating on the gig you’ve brought your friends to.

You’ll need

A deep understanding of data warehousing and data lakes
Outstanding SQL skills
A working knowledge of Python
Experience working with dbt
Experience developing for BI tools, preferably Looker
Proven experience working in a data analytics or engineering role
The ability to interpret data analysis requirements and translate them into efficient data models
If you have some familiarity with data pipelines and dataflow management tools (e.g. Airflow, Prefect) that will definitely be useful, but it’s not essential for the role.

About DICE

Our teams work from London, New York, Los Angeles, Barcelona, Paris and Milan. We’re building products that will revolutionise the industry for fans, artists and venues – and we’re growing fast. Read about our latest Series C funding and what’s next for DICE.
We know that having a variety of perspectives makes us a better company – it's why we strongly encourage members of underrepresented communities to apply. Find out how we're creating a more diverse, equitable and inclusive DICE.

Our benefits

Unlimited holiday
Private health insurance
Workplace pension
Free therapy and coaching

During the pandemic, we’ve learned that working from home can help us focus, but many of us are missing the buzz of the office. We’re still figuring out the best way for us all to work together in the future, and we’ll involve the whole team in any decisions we make.

Application process

Our process usually involves a quick chat on the phone, a portfolio review and/ or task and a couple of interviews where you’ll meet the people you’ll work with. We’ll keep you fully informed along the way.

For information on how we use your data, please view our Candidate Privacy Policy

81e1736f7c66587a.title: Digital Analytics Implementation Engineer
81e1736f7c66587a.description:
We are looking for an Analytics Engineer to own our tagging and implementation offering.


Our Strategy & Insights team has been responsible for embedding a data-driven culture within our agency and across our client base. We are currently using Google Tag Manager for our analytics solutions but require you to come and unlock its full potential so we can further advance our insights into customer engagement and conversions to further optimise our clients’ digital products.


Key responsibilities

Own and develop the analytics tagging offering
Create analytics specifications
Implement, test and manage web analytics solutions within Google Tag Manager
Develop and implement custom solutions using JavaScript
Work with our frontend and backend developers in our engineering team to agree analytics tagging standards
Work with our test team to improve testing and automation
Consult with clients on the benefits of analytics solutions


Skills and experience

Analytics tagging experience with Google Tag Manager, including marketing tag implementation
Hands-on experience in Javascript
Experience in working with data layers and analytics libraries
Knowledge of Google Analytics 4
Agency experience is preferred
Experience working with analytics solutions of digital experience platforms, specifically Sitecore and Optimizely is desirable but not essential

2f5e9d32cdcccbd4.title: Quantitative Trading Lead Engineer
2f5e9d32cdcccbd4.description:
Job title: Quantitative Trading Lead Engineer
Location: London
Corporate Title: Vice President
You will be joining the Quantitative Fixed Income Engineering team, a part of the Group Strategy Analytics group, are building applications that deliver quantitatively led pricing and trading solutions for the Rates & Credit business. You will work closely with engineers, quants and traders to deliver high performance, low latency trading applications. You will have the opportunity to use your excellent Java skills and experience of modern software development practices to create high quality systems that can be iterated on rapidly and safely.
What we’ll offer you
A healthy, engaged and well-supported workforce are better equipped to do their best work and, more importantly, enjoy their lives inside and outside the workplace. That’s why we are committed to providing an environment with your development and wellbeing at its centre.
You can expect:
Competitive salary and non-contributory pension
30 days’ holiday plus bank holidays, with the option to purchase additional days
Life Assurance and Private Healthcare for you and your family
A range of flexible benefits including Retail Discounts, a Bike4Work scheme and Gym benefits
The opportunity to support a wide ranging CSR programme + 2 days’ volunteering leave per year
Your key responsibilities:
Responsible for Implementing and delivering new business functions and non-functional platform improvements
Responsible for developing functional and non-functional requirements in close collaboration with other engineers, Quants and Traders
Responsible for participating fully in code reviews as both an author and a reviewer
Responsible for actively improving team software development processes

Your skills and experience:
Excellent core Java
An understanding of trading systems, preferably in an algorithmic trading context
Demonstrable technical skills beyond core Java, particularly relevant are: Python, knowledge database , messaging middleware (solace, Lattice-Boltzmann Method ) & their application to event driven systems
Experience of modern patterns for continuous delivery of software
A sound grounding in the principals of computer engineering, preferably with a technical degree

How we’ll support you:
Training and development to help you excel in your career
Flexible working to assist you balance your personal priorities
Coaching and support from experts in your team
A culture of continuous learning to aid progression
A range of flexible benefits that you can tailor to suit your needs
About us and our teams
Deutsche Bank is the leading German bank with strong European roots and a global network.
Our values define the working environment we strive to create – diverse, supportive and welcoming of different views. We embrace a culture reflecting a variety of perspectives, insights and backgrounds to drive innovation. We build talented and diverse teams to drive business results and encourage our people to develop to their full potential. Talk to us about flexible work arrangements and other initiatives we offer.

We promote good working relationships and encourage high standards of conduct and work performance. We welcome applications from talented people from all cultures, countries, races, genders, sexual orientations, disabilities, beliefs and generations and are committed to providing a working environment free from harassment, discrimination and retaliation.

191b17b04c1ac55b.title: Partner Senior Solution Engineer, BI & Analytics - Tableau
191b17b04c1ac55b.description:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Sales
Job Details
Partner Senior Solution Engineer, BI & Analytics - Tableau
Who we are...

At Tableau, we are passionate about data. We believe in helping everyone see and understand their data. We are on a mission to democratise data, and help build data driven organisations. We are a market leader, and we continue to massively invest in our innovative technology on behalf of our customers.


With Tableau and Salesforce synergy, we have a substantial market opportunity, and we continue to grow at a rapid pace. We are proud to be a company that has strong values, and trying to make a positive impact on our communities and planet. We invest in our people and are a people first company. We’ve been voted a top company in World’s Best Place to Work for a reason.
Our Partner Solution Engineering role is responsible for partnering with our partner business in promoting the power of Tableau platform to our partner ecosystem under the one analytics strategy which includes Tableau core products (Desktop, Server, Online, Embedded) and Tableau CRM (formerly Einstein Analytics)

Some of the things you’ll be accomplishing include…
You will be a pioneer in igniting the power of Tableau platform to our partner ecosystem under the one analytics strategy which includes Tableau core products (Desktop, Server, Online, Embedded) and Tableau CRM (formerly Einstein Analytics)
You will help generate excitement within new and existing Tableau partners, and drive further growth in EMEA
You will provide the technical expertise, know-how and thought leadership to make our partners successful
You will be a trusted partner to our partners, and engage with their senior stakeholders to help them build a stronger Tableau proposition and offering for their customers
You will partner with partner sales team, partner marketing, partner enablement, and fellow Tableau and TCRM SEs to help grow our partner revenue and impact
You will help drive a massive Tableau opportunity within system integrators, value added resellers, strategic tech alliances and scaled distribution partners
You will keep yourself up-to-date and invest in your trainings and certification on an ongoing basis
You will be a go-to-expert for our partners looking for guidance on topics like architecture, security, scalability, performance, authentication, data strategy, AI, NLP, ML, cloud and Salesforce customer 360.
Who you are…
Passionate about data demonstrated by education, experience, hobby and/or interest.
Knowledge of Demonstrated strong Salesforce platform knowledge and hands-on experience
Demonstrated experience with topics on enterprise architecture, security, scalability, authentication, data strategy and/or cloud
Demonstrated interest or experience in data visualisation, predictive analytics, ML, NLP, AI and/or Statistics
Preferably with exposure and experience on various industry verticals
Strong commercial acumen and a business builder mentality
Enjoys working with partners and building a strong partner ecosystem
Enjoys presenting to large audiences, and to senior stakeholders
Enjoys evangelising and thought leadership opportunities
Previous experience with Tableau, TCRM or Einstein Analytics a big plus
Previous experience with Salesforce platform as an administrator would be a nice to have
Self starter and ability to manage competing priorities well
Enjoys investing in continuous learning and growth
Believes in succeeding as a high performing diverse team
Minimum of 5-10 years experience in technical pre-sales or consulting preferred
Fluency in English and Local Language is required.
Pre-Sales, Presales, Pre Sales, Solution Consultant, Solutions Consultant, Solution Architect, Solution Engineer Analytics, Business Intelligence, Tableau, Data Visualisation

3891d188fc090a99.title: BI Engineer – HYBRID WORKING
3891d188fc090a99.description:
18409

£38k – 40k per year + benefits

BI Engineer – HYBRID WORKING

Our client is looking to enhance the BI Team with an experienced BI engineer working on a HYBRID BASIS of 2 days in the office and 3 from home.

The BI Engineer is multifaceted role that includes the development, operation, maintenance and user adoption of BI products and services to support the business intelligence vision. Development may be across any of the assets and processes in the BI supply chain, to include end user reports; corporate data sets; data warehousing and operational data stores; data flows and transformations; data preparation and extraction; and master data management. Operations will include undertaking and monitoring of scheduled tasks and responding to user issues

ESSENTIAL SKILLS

Graduate or equivalent by experience in a relevant subject/discipline.


Circa 3 years or more relevant experience working in a data discipline.
Proven experience driving and developing technical DWH/ Data Sets;
Technical skills to include at least 2 off the following, SQL, SSIS, SSRS, OLAP, SSAS, DAX, MDX
Experience of DWH delivery standards, processes and best practices (Kimball methodologies)
A passion for Data and Information with a strong understanding of how to use BI to best enable Self Service BI reporting and analysis;

Due to the volume of applications received for positions, it will not be possible to respond to all applications and only applicants who are considered suitable for interview will be contacted.

Proactive Appointments Limited operates as an employment agency and employment business and is an equal opportunities organisation
